My wife and I have co-oped our way through most of the content this game has to offer so far in early access and can both easily say it was worth the $20 we each spent. I went pretty crazy with building and made a couple of nice huge bases. One of our favorite things about the game is how simple the building and crafting is. Its not trying to be so realistic that you have too much on your plate to look for and unlocking new things to craft isn't so complex that it becomes a chore. Everything is pretty straightforward and easy to figure out, but there is a lot to make and find and build already even this early in development. I hope they don't end up over-complicating things to the point that its not so fun anymore, but i sure welcome lots of new things to make and discover. 

Primary things we hope to see from this game: 
Actual animations for things you do would be great, so players with you can see where you are looking and what you are doing. I should be able to see that my wife is scanning around with her binoculars as I drive the boat. When she is crafting something or eating, I should be able to see that too. 
A 3rd person camera option would be great. 
I'd love to be able to at least hold a button to locate other friendly players without going to my map. 
There needs to be an option to strap 2 or 3 air tanks together or build better ones because the tanks don't last long enough IMO. 
Racks made to hold metal scrap should hold a LOT more than they do, otherwise they are pretty pointless and we might as well only build boxes to store metal scrap. 
When you die there is no clear indicator what bed you are choosing to respawn at and it's not consistently any of the options. Hard to get back to the fight when you respawned at a base miles away. Maybe allowing players to fast travel between beds/bases would help with this if the bed spawn locations aren't made more clear. 
Some sea-life variety would go a long way to making the ocean feel more alive and scary, especially things like huge whales in the deeper areas or pods of dolphins swimming and breaching the surface as you boat around. 
Being able to actually sit in chairs and sofas you make or find would be nice too. 

Biggest problem I have with gun combat is how many times I should have been hitting an enemy but the gaps in bushes or trees and holes in fences and walls were not really openings at all, so I waste a lot of ammo shooting invisible walls when I was trying to fire through a big obvious gap in a wood fence. And as others have said, enemy AI is awful, but that's expected for early access.
Water world meet The Forest. Focusing on air are a different spin abut great

although i only have a measly 5 hours played so far, it is one of my survival fav games at the moment. i was hesitant to try it; however, i am glad my impulse got the best of me because i love it so far. like any game in early access there are going to be some improvements that need to be made and here are some suggestions that i would consider adding in the future.

- the ability to "shift" click items into your backpack/storage
- allowing access to all slots in your hotbar with scroll wheel
- items automatically filling your hotbar when your backpack is full
- add the ability to confirm consuming items (e.g., right click to confirm consumption so i stop incorrectly hot keying to the wrong slots and accidentally consuming items)

aside from that i can't wait to see how this game progresses in the future i am very excited to see its growth! and, if you are thinking about buying it def try it out i think it is worth it.

This game is actually pretty good for the average open world survival craft.

Some of the downsides are:
- Anything underwater feels like a chore because oxygen runs out very fast, even with an oxygen tank and the battery powered scooter thing.
- There's a lack of reliable sources for some items like leather (hide)
- AI is a bit overpowered if you get too close. The rifle with scope could counter this but it's too short-ranged and the enemies are often too obstructed by flora to be sniped

The biggest downside of all:
This game LOVES to crash, more than any other game I've ever played. It'll just freeze for 2 seconds and close. It does have a default autosave for what it feels like 5 minute intervals, but you won't be thrilled to lose 5 minutes of crafting and building. It's even worse if you lose 5 minutes of looting stuff you needed, because, each time you load the world, loot gets randomized.

Very fun game! Dynamic and with a lot of depth to it (no pun intended). It scales really well and allows for an interesting base-building defense-like style. The exploration is very unique with its subaquatic take on adventuring. The ground bases, which serve as sort-of challenge zones with great rewards are difficult in just the right way. That rewarding feeling for successfully taking over an island and getting some sweet loot is a true dopamine rush. This is what dreams are made of.
I have been dreaming of a Waterworld Film inspired game for decades now, and if you have been too this is the closest we have to it. This title has so much potential!

Loving it so far. Rust on water with enemy NPCs.
Very rough as it is in Alpha, but the game loop and construction mechanics work great so far. 

Plenty of interesting clothing choices that benefit your survival chances right off the bat which is a nice addition. Day night cycle, good map with plenty of unique places you can locate. Would be cool to see different weather cycles, which could affect how rough the water is. Another idea is fantasy/apocalyptic weathers even such as Tornados, which could target OP players dominating servers, Acid Rain showers, which could melt wood and rust metal, etc. 

Build boats, drive a Jet-Ski, kill mutants and survivors armed with spears, axes, crossbows, and various guns. Dive underwater to loot all your building materials, furniture and vanity items which you can place on your player built homes and rafts, or scouted locations on your map. Islands have trees to cut down, all well implemented and functions properly. 

It would be cool to see a boat building method similar to Garry's Mods sandbox mechanics (The game mode Naval Play/Warfare and Sledbuild comes to mind). More fish is the other biggest lacking thing at the moment. Making the sea feel more populated and dangerous is a a big plus. With this could come some better fishing mechanics such as minigames similar to Dredge. 

Any form of XP shown and earned towards combat, fishing, swimming, would bring other audiances in too (Runescape leveling and Animal Crossing communities with this game would be next level). Another idea could be fetch quests for the traders to encourage returning to existing places. 

While the current music is fair, the sound design is lacking. Looping sounds and effects reminiscent of old Source games. Offer people voice roles to make the NPC raids more effective. They succeed in creating panic for sure, but something like 3 goons on Jet-Skis screaming obscenities would be more memorable. 

This base foundation of this game for the price is well worth it. Support small developers, could be the next Rust. However, the potential lies in properly implemented multiplayer which at this point we have on average 3 player max servers between dozens of peer to peer players. I understand the server costs but even half a dozen global 64 player servers with a queue would be perfect. 

If you liked Naval Warfare, the Waterworld Fallout 3 mod, Rust, farming simulators, survival games, Waterworld, Subnautica... this is something to support. This game is a massive task and i applaud the game we've got so far. Support small developers, support the potential this has. I love it so far.

For an EA the game has a lot of potential. This is what Subnautica and RAFT was missing for me - a lot more fighting. Now for the game - I played 1-2 hours on normal diff and everything was good for me. Then I switched to Insane/ max diff settings. Everything is good until you meet GUNS and the game changes for BAD. Your only option is to abuse the Old Bolt Rifle and shoot the enemies from far, far away. You go around the POI with your boat and you shoot and shoot until you hope there are no more than 2-3 enemies in the base. And then you go and they 1 shot you most of the time and you go back and hope they will spawn outside so you can kill them and get the POI. On higher diff the armor doesn't matter with or without you will be 1-2 shot from the enemies even with medium/long range shotgun enemies. 
And all this becomes even worse when they raid you. If you don't build you base with big enough distance between your second floor and them, they will swim under you and start shooting through the walls with shotguns and you will die instantly.
Then you have the resources - I feel there are TOO many resources from some kinds that you don't know what to do. So you use the trader to dump all this resources to buy chemicals, electronics. The only important resource that I can see in the long run are chemicals as you need them to produce gasoline. Also traders underwater scooter is just TOO GOOD. Little battery usage and major speed boost - they should maybe swap with the headlight usage which is limited for 1 minute probably :). 

At the end I think the game is worth just don't play it on max difficulty for now.

This is an amazing start. I have sunk so many days into this game and it's been pure fun, every minute. 

A few loves; inventory system is very fluid and easy to get a hang of, big fan. The military backpack *chefs kiss* and the chest storage space, amazing for hoarders like me. 

I love the graphics so far, it is super immersive and I absolutely love diving into the depths of the ocean to scavenge anything and everything from each location. 

Combat is incredibly hard and rewarding, and the guns are very familiar of a Rust-Skyrim style system that I cannot wait to see improved with each update. 

Raids are so hard, and make things very difficult depending on your settings. You just gather enough resources for that grill and all of a sudden a bunch of bast*rds come and tear it up, as well as the very foundations beneath your feet. 

Base-building is super customisable with many different decorations and furniture already, which is super impressive. Hard to get going but once you grind a little bit and depending on your respawn settings for the loot, also super rewarding. 

A few comments; charcoal needs another purpose. Once you move past the homemade weapons, and no longer need black-powder, it is useless. Please, let us use this instead of wood in the machines that require burning fuel. It would make sense, as at first it is hard to come by and once you get going, wood is incredibly scarce but charcoal plentiful. 

I hope there are some plans to add additional wildlife to the islands and specifically the ocean. The odd small fish, group of 2-3 Marlin, sea turtles and 2 different types of sharks that all swim in a circle becomes no challenge. Make the sharks spawn randomly and let them move all around the locations at different depths please. And once there is more to look at beneath the water *wildlife*, it will be super immersive. 

And the ability to talk to NPC's like the trader featured in the trailer is so exciting. For the love of god though, pretty-please add some triangular foundations and floors. <3  This game has so much potential, please keep up the hard work as it is VERY much appreciated.

It has been a while since i have seen a game that i think is worth playing but this one ticks all my boxes. There are to many MMO spawn and shoot games which don't interest me so when i saw this i thought i would give it a go. REALLY glad i did, I love it!! It is a unique game as most of it takes place under water and the aim is to survive. You start with nothing and scavenge for parts and resources to help build a base and increase the depths and time you can stay under water. 
Most other games today where you can build a base are limited so your base ends up being just a square empty box, why bother building it. This game is different, as you build and expand you can add items such as beds, chairs rugs stoves and all manor of other things not only to assist you in survival but also make the place your own. There is some conflict with other factions to keep you on your toes but the main focus is survival which is something i really enjoy. You can start your own single player game and then also invite your friends in to either assist in your base or build one of their own.
I love the concept I think that the major developers could really learn something from this, We don't all want to Spawn shoot and die, some of us still want build and survive as the main focus, very creative idea. So if you are in the same mind as me then i really recommend you give this a go. 
(my only criticism is that the days and nights go really quick, so maybe your could slow down the clock a little?)

I have just over 65 hours in game. I give it a 7 out of 10 and would not recommend it until it is far more polished. Structural integrity is not needed. You place pillars to build floors and ceilings only to be able to take the pillars out after you're done. Makes no sense. The blueprint furniture items are out of place. Nice furniture next to rusty floors and walls. The workstation models look like blobs of rust with very little detail. The speedboat vanished after spending hours gathering the needed materials. The AI is really bad. Shoot one guy and the guy next to him is not alerted. They then proceed to walk the same route back and forth. Base attacks are even worse. Enemies able to shoot through walls, but you can't. Enemies glitching through foundations. First they're in the water and then they're in front of you fighting. Had one actually glitch through a wall and get inside my base. You can also grab and access items through walls. The water and underwater exploration is nice, but the only threat is running out of air. As you progress through the game, much of the items are no longer needed. Attacking AI bases is simple. Have the bolt action rifle, shotgun and eagle for shooting from afar and grenades for up close. The grenades work great.

This is one of the best concepts bringing together so very many facets of modern survival adventure. That said, it is early yet and it needs support. The game feels young yet better polished than its rivals like 7 days to die in a much shorter time. The customization gives me fallout vibes and I was really satisfied at what things they chose to focus on and how the game play feels as an avid survival/adventure player. Over the next few years I am very excited to see how this game grows and adapts.

It desperately needs more locations and a bigger play area in my opinion, I don't mind a loading screen but I can't travel for 5 minutes and reach the end of a map, it just feels empty. The content however is under the water, and I have to remind myself to explore the real areas of focus. This makes it more linear style and perhaps there should be a sort of leashing system like sharks, monsters, or the need for resources to prevent you from going too far out early on. Would love to see storms and big weather events though it can be complicated.

I love survival/crafting/base building games so I was excited to give Sunkenland a try. The game is still in early access so there are a few bugs, but definitely playable.  I really enjoyed diving and gathering materials to create my own base.  Running out of air and fighting off sharks was a credible threat.  I appreciated the ability to turn off npc raiding in the settings so I didn't have to worry about my base being invaded- though I was still able to go and raid the npc islands and bases.  Raiding and gunplay is not one of my favorite aspects of the game... especially since enemies respawn rather quickly, meaning you can't ever clear the map and "win". It would be nice if future updates allowed for that option for us singleplayers who like well defined goals.  Overall, an enjoyable game that I'll be willing to play again in the future.

This game is in early access at the time of this being posted.  The Dev's have done a good job of listening to criticism and have been busy patching issues identified by the players.  There is a lot of opportunity for future expansion in this game, but it's a great start.  Food has been balanced, being slightly easier to find, but not a sure thing.  Strawberry seeds were over abundant when the game first came out (occurred roughly 80% of the time a strawberry was eaten) and now occur significantly less frequently (probably now closer to 10 to 15%).  This is fun to play and there's a lot to do, but it's not impossible to "beat the game".  Goals and targets are up to the player.  I have seen a playlist in You Tube where the player managed to kill all the NPC Opponents in the game and cleared all the islands.  NPC accuracy was an issue that was fixed and player accuracy was a problem that was fixed.  In the play round I just finished, I managed to shoot down a seagull, which would have been nearly impossible in early play...

Pro's-
Game looks stunning.
Movement and game play mechanics are fantastic, very much like Rust.
No steep learning curve, if you've played any survival game you'll pick this up in 10 mins.
So much to explore, NPC gunfights are challenging until you have top tier weapons/armour ,keeps it interesting.
Base building is easy and there's a big focus on decoration with some cool looking items. 

Cons-
Game crashes are a thing, maybe 1 or 2 per hour which isn't a deal breaker as it's early access
Game rolls back loot which is a HUGE pain in the ass, you can spend 10-15 mins looting and if it rolls back you lose the hard work, and NPC which you have killed the bodies despawn ,devs need to sort this.

Annoyances- Mainly loot and inventory.

Would i recommend this game - 100% yes even in it's current state , the slight annoyances don't deter from a stunning looking game that's great fun to play.

Buggy, yes, but after 34 hours "sunk" into the game (hehehe) it's really chill.  There are some quirks for sure...

The combat is.. interesting. The enemies are pretty unresponsive and just stare off in the distance until you shoot at them and actually hit.  You can shoot an enemy directly next to another and only the one you shoot at will turn and start firing back.

The building aspect is fun, like a bell curve as far as difficulty to acquire parts. Farm runs are pretty standard.  Underwater has a lot to offer, but I will say I was a bit let down when I found out how weak sharks were to fight. I thought it would be a lot more difficult.

One thing that drives me insane is how the foliage will grow back IN YOUR HOUSE.  It's such a small thing but damn it gets to you after awhile.  You'll go to chop it back down and end up halving the hp of your wall instead lol.

Flying boats is another cool bug.  Pretty spectacular when dropped loot is such a huge obstacle that the logic is for your boat to fly over the top of it.  Like 50 feet in the air.
It is a good game in my book

Fantastic game! Especially for early development. If the devs continue with this game, I think it will rival Rust! An awesome alternative to it! You can turn off or on raids, explore the sea, other islands and fight zombies on other islands (with raids turned off, btw). Needs some tweaks to it but to be expected. If you like Rust, Subnautica / Stranded Deep, you'll love this game. Nice features for crafting. Tons to do at your own pace. Very relaxing. Almost forgot to mention, the zombies are not mindlessly dumb, You attack one area, they stay for a bit, then move around, trying to get to your back side. Just when you think you've killed them all, two sneak up behind you jumping out of the water. Some are kind of predictable, but it keeps things lively. I highly recommend this game!

I get the game is in early access and there's yet to be added several mechanics that make it better, but they really left the game feeling lackluster and full of problems - like the bar shouldn't be this low already - It really puts a bad taste in the mouth when attempting a playthrough, especially since the way games are designed these days, commercial games release a game and add bugfixes later, it's really difficult to understand and stay aware of the fact that developement could be in it's very early crucial development days...

But there should be a level that games like this add reasonable traits to the game that make it workable and it seems like there isn't that much in this game as it stands now, it seems very barebones. 

Game is good and Im definitely hopeful of a better future - it might not be now. 

Problems I have center mainly on combat and current simplistic design choices - Alot of the mechanics are incompatible and not balanced thoroughly enough in my opinion, note that I mean that it isn't balanced *for a early access game ie it's almost not balanced at all* raids and tech advancements need to scale, hitboxes should be better for aiming - combat mechanics should in general try to avoid skyrim mechanics etc 

Anyway idk it's frustrating to play and doesn't seem achievable to play unless you have friends and intense understanding of game battle strategy - It gets boring in the logistics and resource collection and idk maybe needs more tuning to make it challenging while also being more freeing, there should be more to it, and more stuff to get. 

Im sure this game will get better in the future..

The concept of Sunkenland was indeed intriguing and held great promise, but regrettably, the execution of the game fell far short of my expectations. Here are the specific issues I encountered that led to my dissatisfaction with the game:

Poor Construction and Building Mechanics: The core construction and building elements in the game were not as engaging as I had anticipated. The building mechanics were cumbersome and lacked the depth and versatility that would have made them enjoyable.

Repetitiveness: The gameplay quickly became monotonous due to its repetitive nature. There was a noticeable lack of variety in tasks and activities, which greatly diminished the overall enjoyment of the game.

Lack of Fun: While I initially expected to have an enjoyable gaming experience, I found that Sunkenland failed to provide any meaningful entertainment or fun factor. The gameplay felt tedious and unengaging.

Poor Optimization: The game suffered from severe optimization issues, leading to performance problems on my system. This negatively impacted my ability to play and enjoy the game to its fullest potential.

Lack of Content: There was a distinct lack of content in the game, leaving me with a limited range of activities and objectives. This made the game feel underdeveloped and unfinished.

I play solo only.

The game run smoothly overall (no big frame dip, no bad bug on my side).

Base building is a bit clunky at time when placing block but works OK otherwise (rotation and depth tend to change quickly as you move but standing still before building make it a non-issue).

There is some progression (bow => crossbow => some meh gun but cheap => better guns for more costly, along some melee upgrade and very small tool upgrade).

You can craft more "efficient" (cost less wood to run them) station rather quickly, farm some ressources at home (cotton/cloth, wood, food).

Cooking is quickly irrelevant because you find a lot of food/water especially later and it's fster and more easy to simply replant ready-to-eat things like strawberry, lemon, lettuce rather than than bother cook stuff one by one with a delay between each dish you make (cooking station cost a fair bit so you can't really spam them to take less time).

You need to dive a fair bit, can equip fins to swim faster and use pills or equip reusable air tank (you can swap underwater to extend the timer) to stay for a long period of time.

Some place can be looted stress-free (no enemies) while some other require killing basic mutans (melee, crossbow), or mercenary/slaver/etc with different kind of guns.

You do get attacked now and then; They do destroy building rather quickly if they stack against a single spot, so it can be a bit hard later to deal with them in solo.

The AI doesn't "refresh" it's state very often; They do react quickly if they spot you, move around somewhat randomly, have good aim so you will get killed quickly if you try to attack from the front (armor break down fast and you don't have a lot of hp).
On the other hand, the IA doesn't "turn" : if they spot you from ... say the south, you can swim around and attack them on their back and it take a fair bit before they decide to (all) turn around and shoot at you.
So it's best to simply circle around them and take a shot when you can. Or swim bellow them and melee (can't shoot in the water so it's safe), or walk under the floor they stand and melee them trough the floor.
Or use grenades (very effective way to kill).

To me, that's enough "gunplay" for this type of game to be fine, but it could use more reactive AI (you can kill at long range one by one, they don't react unless close enough or if they take damage) and maybe have them heal if you leave them for too long.

Electricity sucks though cost too much and do very little. It'sa waste of ressources, making the last tech tier quite useless beside boat/armor upgrade.

Overall a good game. I recommend playing it.

I recently started playing a new game that has truly exceeded my expectations. It's like a fantastic blend of Rust and Minecraft, combining the best elements of both. What surprised me the most is how water-oriented the game is. The underwater world is incredibly captivating, and it's only going to get better from here.

The game already boasts a stunning ocean environment that's as delightful to explore as it is visually appealing. There's a satisfying amount of activities to dive into beneath the waves, but what really excites me is the untapped potential for even more underwater adventures. I can't wait to see how this aspect of the game evolves.

In summary, this game is a real gem for anyone who loves Rust and Minecraft. The underwater elements make it stand out, and the promise of future content has me genuinely excited. It's a must-try for anyone who enjoys open-world exploration and creative building.

Sunkenland is like if Raft, Subnautica, and Sons of the Forest had a perfect game baby. A work-in-progress build that's constantly being updated with no game breaking bugs (for me or my friends). Sure there a a few glitches here and there but they're so hilarious you kinda want them to happen again. If you're on the fence about the game, I have roughly 60 hours in game and half of it is solo play. There's near-endless playability alone and with friends. Not to mention, the base building is fantastic with a good bit of decorations to craft and fun vehicles to build and ride around in! SO go grab the homies, drop a few dollars, and hop into your new survival world. You better be prepared to fight though, you aren't alone out there.
Breath, eat and live with scraps

I love this game, the world setting and the many possibilities.
The setting is basically like the movie from 1995 Waterworld, if you have seen this movie and liked it, you will love this game!
Ofcourse there are many things still to be improved as its an early access, but you can already play the game, experience the world and build a nice base. 
The following improvements i hope the developers will implement:
1. Basebuilding in the water needs floaters instead of poles which do not reach the bottom.
2. It is not so realistic that if you have a water base without a proper path from land, that the swimming enemies will still shoot a crossbow or make headshots with their guns. To load a crossbow while swimming in deep water is extremely difficult. 
3. The enemies also need to get boats which we can take over after a fight
4. We need to be able to sneak attack or at least get dmg bonusses for a sneak attack
5. We need to be able to flatten all buildings on an island and in the water to get even more materials. This could be an end game drill or something.
6. We need to have a electric water purifier with a hose which can reach the sea water so you dont have to do the bucket walk / pumping all the time.
7. We need to be able in our base to utilize all materials in the storage units.
8. We need a harpoon to shoot the fishes or at least a ranged weapon which can function under water. There are some conventional weapons which can be used. 
9. It would be cool to make alliances with some groups and be able to trade and make trade or real wars with others. 
10. We need an underwater submarine with a grabber
11. We need to be able to build an underwater base! especially end game this could be cool that you get divers which will attack your base.
12. We need naval mines.  
13. A chainsaw for cutting the trees

Looking forward for the next updates. It would be cool if the dev team can release every two or three weeks a small update same like Sons of the Forest does so you are always hooked.

Progression? Starting up is tough, but once the ball is rolling, it's fantastic.

Gameplay Settings Adjustment? Decent. I wish there was a bit more options here, but what is offered has made my few hours of playtime a day well spent and challenging enough to be fun, but not frustrating.

Story? Nonexistent, and that's fine.

Survival Crafting? Fun, rewarding, build mode doesn't try changing the mold. I do wish I could manually adjust the height of foundations, but it's not a deal breaker. I can pickup crafting stations I've already built without dismantling them into it's parts

This last update just ruined this game for me. The AI can shoot through everything and shoot in the dark. While you have absolutely terrible recoil mechanics and terrible gun visuals. Worse still, for me, as of this update it feels like the Night/Day cycles is 20% day and 120% night time. Plus you will be freezing at night no matter what clothes you wear and your screen will be covered in frost and you get screen shake. There is no objective. Just go fight terrible AI with 1-shot potential and swim around. Not sure what direction this game is going in but as of now this game is a 1/4. I might give it another try in a few months but probably not. Love the concept but just a bad execution.

Already more content than most AAA titles nowadays, and it's only been in early access for almost two months.  It has pretty typical early access quirks. The devs are clearly still working out the armor system. It's getting a tad repetitive, but the game is still good fun. I imagine it'll be ridiculous with friends. I expect variation and fine-tuning down the road. My only real issue with it is that going underwater becomes pointless after a time. Everything is playable. I have not encountered a game breaking problem. Give it a shot.

Edit: 21 October 2023. I've pretty much done everything there is to do. There are a handful of islands with enemies, but I don't even need to take them down. I have a ton of supplies. I have every good weapon. I have the best armor. I have the helicopter. I can make the best boat, but who cares because of the aforementioned helicopter. Twenty hours of game time in early access. That's one hour of play per USD spent. My bar is set at getting at least thirty minutes per dollar. This game doubling that so early on makes it a great deal in my book.

I only have two issues with the game. First, When building a structure if you make a mistake you can not dis-mantel the piece that is placed wrong. The roofing always has an opening that you cannot roof. The ladder size cannot be manipulated to fit. It is always too long to match a second-story structure. Once it is placed you cannot remove it. My second issues is with the storage of all the material you need to progress through the game. I am constantly building boxes. Bigger storage containers would be great. I forgot to mention another issue and that is flying the helicopter or should I say trying to fly it. There is no control for forward motion, you can turn right or left but it wants to roll on an axis if you do. You can ascend or descend but not go forward so in the game it is worthless. Other wise I enjoy the game.

There are many survival titles out there, each unique in their own way. Once in a while a game would come around that is simply unexpected and interesting. Such is Sunkenland in my opinion. The concept is pretty good, if not masterful. Here we have something that can turn into a great intense title. I would recommend avid survivalists to certainly give Sunkenland a try. Compliments to the developer/s in bringing us something different in this theatre. Would be really nice to see a second map creation option to play without any islands at all. Just water. With floating rafts/bases this will certainly put pressure to dive into the depths below to bring up loot to expand your base. Dropping a dragging net to the bottom of the ocean floor in the hope in returning some random loot caught, would be nice too. Great title, would certainly recommend.

Like 7 Days to Die and Waterworld with Kevin Costner had a baby... and man is it a beautiful baby.  It's good.  REAL GOOD.  Building, gathering  resources, and crafting are intuitive and fun - just the right amount of grind.  Periodic raids on your base are tough.  The enemies are tough.  Still working out my defenses and trying to get enough firepower to hold them off without too much panic.  I love checking out new POI's, raiding enemy encampments, and finding hidden loot caches.  I'm looking forward to some more defensive structures that damage enemies.... did I say the periodic raids on your base are tough?  They're tough!  This is the survival crafting game I've been searching for.  I hope this developer makes a zombie version because this game is excellent and I can't wait to see where it lands once it's out of early access.  Yes, it's absolutely worth the money.  Buy it yesterday.

1. **Concept and Potential:**
   - Begin with the premise of your strong affinity for Sunkenland and the potential for it to be the next day's gone if guided correctly.

2. **Gameplay Refinements:**
   - Discuss areas that require improvement for a smoother gaming experience.
     - Implement shortcuts for accessing the enemy menu quickly.
     - Add enemy elimination announcements, especially for headshots.
     - Allow players to toggle the display of the enemy's life bar.
     - Offer the option to select or deselect flags on islands, or boat signs. 
     - allow dragging an entire stack of Items or just click it for selling stuff. 

3. **Enhancing Gameplay:**
   - Suggest gameplay enhancements to make it more engaging.
     - Incorporate a mouse middle button function for inventory weapon switching.
     - Introduce an underwater hospital with it a new item. for healing, which can also be crafted. An aid kit.
     - Introduce the possibility of players to get infections that can be treated with antibiotics.
     - Include larger aquatic creatures like whales and squids.
     - more mutants underwater.( What was actually all about in the beginning) 

4. **Economic System:**
   - Discuss the introduction of an in-game economy.
     - Assign silver coin values to every in-game item to create a pricing system. Those can be bought and sold using coins. 

5. **Narrative and Immersion:**
   - Emphasize the importance of a compelling storyline and immersion.
     - Discuss the potential of combining elements of Sunkenland with Days Gone, for example.
     - Suggest more underwater activities, weapons, and scuba diving equipment etc. Like the day's gone had the motorcycle to be updated, introduce the boat or something like that, constantly being updated; storage, armour, speed, fuel capacity, arm your boat with weapons, etc. 
     - Introduce communities or one community that offer missions, blueprints, and bandanas as rewards. Bandanas can be dropped from raiders colour coded depending on the clan. Each is worth more silver coins. 
     - Highlight the significance of missions and their impact on the game.

6. **Extended Gameplay:**
   - Conclude with the idea of extending the gameplay experience.
    - Suggest adding 5 new missions to the game with each update. Something like do this and you get that.
     - Propose starting with the first mission at the trade shop.
     - Describe how players could encounter various characters within communities, each offering unique missions and knowledge.
Like a doctor will have the blueprints for an antibiotic recipes, or first aid kit recipe. 
A mechanic can unluck your boat blueprints and boat update blueprints.
A cook with unluck you food recipes. 
A gunman can unlucky you guns and bullets blueprints. 
A carpenter unlocks you all those furniture and all those crafting Tables you are using in the game. 
Imagine instead of dealing yourself with the raiders you can make guns and give them to people from your community. 
Costume your own Bandana that you were on your arm. 

All those missions having a level that can be updated with each mission. Each unlocking the new item you can craft.

     - Discuss the idea of underwater combat and its role in the game. After all it's called sunkenland and most of the action happens on land. 


7. **Final Thoughts:**
   - Mention that while Sunkenland is enjoyable, it tends to lose its appeal after approximately 20 hours, underscoring the potential for these enhancements to reinvigorate the gaming experience.

Adding a story line and a goal to the game will change it for sure. Motivating the player to play further adding achievements and missions will totally give it justice.

A fun game that I find relaxing to play. I enjoy the building aspect, and the "takeover" part as well against the enemy factions.
I kind of call it "advanced minecraft" , which may not be fair to the game or Minecraft, but you do farm resources and build, and then fend off raids of enemies. But this is NOT a bad thing at all.
It's still in active development, so lots of things still to come, and of course some bugs, but overall I would highly recommend this game!
There still needs to be some balancing of what resources you get from what items, as well as crafting "costs" of some things need better balancing, but again it's still in development.
If you are on the fence, take the plunge, it can be a really fun experience!

My wife and I have been enjoying the game thus far. Are there bugs? Yes. Is there room for improvement? Yes. Is it fun? Yes!

Pros:
- Factions
- Co-op
- Base building
- Base raids (yours and theirs) :)
- Sailing (motorboat, raft)
- NPCs duck and crouch when trying to shoot them
- Merchants
- Island claiming
- Crafting

Cons:
- Melee combat needs improvement
- Some character animations
- base building (no snaping, hard to line up things like stairs)
- Gettng water (it's doable, just tedious) 
- Mutants coloring (at night they blend in with the shadows and you cannot even see their eyes)

All in all, for an early access game, it is quite enjoyable to play and has good content to keep you occupied for a while. I am looking forward to what the devs do next!

The game is still in beta and has some quirks, but it IS being worked on, and for now it's definitely worth the $20 I paid.

I hardly write reviews for most of the games I play but as far as co-op games go this one deserves it. This game so far is actually a lot of fun to play. Right now I've got two games going on, one with me and my girl, another with some of the homies. I'll tell you what I told them, it's basically Raft on Crack without the annoying voyage and shark constantly destroying your ship. 

As far as Early Access games go this has a lot of potential to expand on, people have already made mods to help smooth over some of the edges that currently exist. I really think the Devs should add some of them to the game. Like 3rd person views, better utility, increased stack sizes, no building restrictions after clearing, key modifier to quick drop items, and a few minor things to really get this game at a place where I could say I could spend 100+ hours on it.

Haven't gotten super far into the game yet but I can see where it's going. We had our raiding group constantly attack a heavily guarded barge naked with spears and lemme tell ya, we died, A LOT. In the end, we had a sense of accomplishment and hella good loot even though we were eradicated a few times lol. (shotguns op vs no armor kek)

To anyone who wants to casually game with some homies, this is a good one that I don't mind supporting to see further development. Devs are active and doing good work, this game is gonna go places if they stay on it. I'll probably write a pro's and con's list later on when I have some more time under my belt, as I can think of a few things but nothing too vital to the game.

overall good early access game. i hope to see this game game get a lot better. needs a lot more wildlife, AI needs a lot of work. %100 playable and fun just needs a lot more polish and content. i would recommend this as a good early access game to anyone who enjoys base building/exploration. the gun play is fun but also needs a lot of work as well.

Very early access and missing very basic QOL features. 
Example, you press "e" to loot all in chests. This cannot be rebound. If your inventory is full your character will still try to loot the whole chest, dropping the extra items on the floor. I'm used to using 'e' to close GUIs from similar titles. You can see where this is going. 

Also the reverse boat controls appear to be swapped? If I rotate left while moving backwards somehow my whole raft rotates left. 

Content looks interesting but it's definitely not worth your money in it's current state.

A great addition to the open world survival craft genre. The ai is smart enough to provide a challenge. The mechanics are well done. I probably only raided less than half the map and I seem to have gotten all the items already. No point in continuing and trying to raid the other areas other than exploration. I also think there needs to be more to discover under the water. Currently the underwater diving areas are used to hold resources and not much to discover. I still loved this game im always looking for new games like this and enjoyed the 10 hours I played. Once they add more content I will go back to it.
Exploration is fine. Building and combat need a lot of work!

few bugs but still fun to play

Absolutely love the game. Love it when early access actually is playable with no issue and so much content. The game unique to what it is and has that different feel to some other sea survival games but has the feeling of Infection, Rust and Stranded deep. The idea of the factions is nice. It gives you the choice of difficulty. You sson learn it's not a good idea to face AR Rifles on a peddle boat. it's strange you can wipe a faction out and take the island for this sort of game but makes me feel there's progression. It also makes me want to sneak. 

Would be great for the ability for stealth kills... I trying and get just behind them but they know lol not good when its a knife in a gun fight. Also a was to dodge especially in the water against sharks as they as sharp turners and 100% accuracy. Got one though lol. Would be great to see raider come in boat or raft some quite other factions noisy for fear. 
All round great game so far so early on. Love it look forward to seeing what comes in the future.

Well this is very fun if you are looking for a quick co-op experience. It does however have a few bugs still, but the devs are quite active and I have no doubt that the bugs will be fixed. At the current price it is well worth a buy!

If you enjoy the survival genre at all this is a good one and definitely worth it! 
i enjoy the depth of the build menu and the tier design, etc, and the boats totally rock!!! couple things id love to see would be like, maybe a cool way to be able to locate your partners, like a GPS locator you can craft and wear so you can be seen by teammates.. and maybe more marine life, *(giant octopus/squid)* lol more of those things that make ya think twice about swimming too far out/deep :)
all in all though love it guys !! with future updates on the way this one is worth your money!

I previously reviewed this and it was positive, but there have since been updates and I have spent a lot more time in game, so this is my latest opinion.

I have no experience with co-op or multiplayer. Just to save some people from further reading.

The game is "early Access" so it's still in development and being tweaked by the people making it and they appear to be monitoring feedback and acting on it either by replying to comments or actually making changes in updates. Good stuff!

I have 41 hours of game play over the last couple of months and personally have never had a technical problem in my solo games. I have never seen issues others have come across thankfully.

Best tip I can give people new to the game is that AI  raids can be controlled in the settings from a low to high level and can also be turned off  until you turn them on again.
I mention this as  raids on your base by the Ai can be pretty brutal and can be a game breaker for some.
Either setting them to low or pausing them until you can catch up on resourced and building will help if you get overwhelmed by the brutality of the attacks.

The game looks fantastic and plays smoothly on my PC (2080 gpu).

Crafting menus are easy to manage and it's fun to build and exploration is fun on islands and especially under water.
It's fun to go and raid the AI camps and it's great seeing them dodge and move when I attack.

The game is very playable now and I personally think it is already worth the money and I am very excited to see this progress into something bigger and better. Fingers crossed.

Have fun!
Cool game indeed

Die because od the same reason. Quit game and dont play this game for 3 days. Leave a reccomendation. That's my story ;)

Fun Game, But i don't recommend playing it until cloud saving is a thing. All your progress is tied to your computer and if you want to play on another device, you don't have your progress.  AI can be iffy most of the time. Sharks will go through walls and hit you.  Theres no cloud gaming support either, Apparently they have been working on adding geforce now for 2 months and there's been no updates.  It will be worth the price point once more things are added. They have way to many vehicles for how small the map is. You can get to every outpost pretty quick with a boat, that can be obtained at the begging of the game. Besides these gripes the game is fun and i look forward to there road map.

Despite the game being pretty bare bones, the game is very well made for a very early access game. It's got everything i want in a survival game. The best part is there is no over-encumbrance. That is easily the most annoying part of survival games.There are some pretty glaring issues but overall it's a great game. Some of the issues include;
.When loading into the game it shows you floating above the water and then drops you into the world. It's very strange to witness.
.The AI is very stupid.
.Base attacks happen too often. Need to lessen it up.
.No creative mode, yet.
Sometimes items disappear from the world, specifically when you are going through the chest on your boat and if you press "take all" and your inventory is full it will unload what you can't carry into the water and it disappears immediately to the person who made the mistake but not to the other players.
good game,like a lot.. waiting for the future updates!!!

I actually really enjoy this game. The only thing i want added/changed is the weapon attachment (red dot). The dot needs to be scaled down a bit, and instead of it being applied to all weapons i should be able to attach to a weapon i want it on. its kind of annoying to have a red dot on a sniper rifle and then having to go into my inventory and take it off, please add an attachment system and add some long range sights. i would also like to see an advanced furnace that smelts more than one ore, it's kind of tedious to have to smelt one ore at a time. Other than those things, the games really fun!
For early access this game is stunning! Can't wait for future updates!

First off, an amazing game, its a lot like a mix of games in a sense (Subsistence, Stranded Deep, Subnautica, some Raft and Rust like vibes, plus the Water World movie concept too) despite their similarity to others they definitely have created a game that truly is one of a kind and no others have come close to making anything like this game. The mechanics, graphics, and quality of life of the game have all been beyond amazing for me tbh. Its early access so understand there are things being fixed, added, changed and updates, lots of them down the line, so plz don't bash an EA game, if you don't like EA games then wish list and wait for updates, full release or whatnot, trust me this game will be beyond amazing when their finished with it for sure, but if you do pick up, be patient with the progression of game, support the devs and join their discord to provide feedback and stay updated the best. Highly recommend to all for real and the devs seem so active, they communicate a lot, it's been a lot of fun, so worth the base price by far.

The latest overhaul update, patches, fixes have been great, plus some nice additions to the game have been a great start to the progress of the game. The devs def communicate, and listen to their feedback, cannot stress that enough, which is why i love the game and appreciate the dev team so much.

I'm a sucker for base building survival games, and one of my fave games is Subnautica, so this seemed like a potential great game when I saw it. I bought it without watching any gameplay of it first. I was expecting a buggy mess due to the early access, and I was almost planning to refund it and wait until it's fully released to possibly try again, but I ended up immediately loving it. In the 10 hours I've played I've maybe encountered 2 bugs, both of which were minor and insignificant. 

I've had lots of fun, building a fancy little base, unlocked several pages of the research bench, and built many machines. I've discovered lots of islands and underwater monuments, and explored multiple. I've enjoyed every moment of it. It's still got some ways to go, and there's functions I wish it had that it doesn't yet, but considering it's early access it's only to be expected. I assume there's lots to come.

I would recommend it today and in the future. If you can wait then it's probably better to wait, as I assume we may lose progress with huge updates etc, or get bugs with "old" worlds. But it is a nice experience being able to take part in the early access, to be there from before release, and see how it grows into a better game over time. So whether you want it today or want to wait is up to you. Playing today will still be lots of fun, and a great experience - but waiting could make the experience better, as it'll have more functions and less bugs (though there's barely any in the first place).

If you get it, have fun! And remember, you're allowed to play on an easier difficulty if that makes it a better experience for you. Games don't have to be hard to be fun.

I have played 75 Hours so far.  An immersive survival game that is very unique.  Solo, Co-op or Multiplayer.  The setting is post apocalypse with the world flooded.  lots of islands to loot and salvage.  However there is more under the water that awaits to be salvaged. The islands are populated by varied clans and tribes, as well as some on built structures that are above water that are defended.  You will get raided from time to time.  They will attack you and your base, which you will have to defend and repair after the attack.  You have lots of resources that you can salvage, but build wisely as you can deplete some of those resources. There are plenty of aquatic wild life that will help sustain your hunger as well as land based plants.  Fresh water, drinks and food are paramount to your survival.  So hunt, scavenge, and farm all you need to give you the edge to be able to survive.  Dive deep, live long and prosper.

Things I would highly recommend bringing to the game to make Sunkenland 5/5:
[list]
[*]Get rid of someone is “occupying the chest”. Please allow multiple people into one chest at the same time.
[*]Increase the duration of batteries. They would be alot more viable if they lasted at least two days instead of 5 minutes. 
[*]Add an upgraded chest or increase the storage of certain chests at least triple the amount.
[*]Add a speargun or some type of underwater weapon that has a range attack.
[*]Add a scope for rifles crafted. 
[*]Increase the attack range of enemies with rifles (don't make them too accurate, or this would be bad).
[*]Add a captain/boss to each island that is different depending on the faction. These bosses should have a unique attack/dodge mechanic to make things a lot more interesting. Maybe add a unique drop for them like a special gun part that can only be obtained by taking out said boss. 
[/list]

How is this game "Very Positive"? I'm sorry but it's one of the most scuffed survival games I've ever played.

-Graphics are bad for a 2023 game
-Building, placement of modules is bad, you can place multiple walls into the same wall
-Enemy AI is atrocious, they teleport inside base, their movement is complete crap, they jump like 5 meters for no reason, also the animations are stupid as hell.
-The whole world interaction is weird, glitchy, you get stuck inside walls, terrain etc.
-Multiple random disconnects with the message "no internet connection available, which is not true. 
-And most annoying of all: IT DOESN'T HAVE CLOUD SAVES. IT LITERALLY CREATES A LOCAL SAVE GAME AND IF YOU CHANGE THE PC, BYE BYE WORLD & CHARACTER.

Yeah, maybe in 1-2 years this game is worth playing, but right now it feels like a "fast cashgrab + abandon in 1 year"
So, open-world survival enjoyers, beware! This is game requires a ton of work and I wouldn't hop on for a while.

I'm leaving my original review at the bottom to show how much progress was made. I admit I was wrong and apologize. In my defense, there have been a LOT of indy games on steam that get 'early access' release then abandoned, so I still think being suspicious was justified. But, again, I was wrong.

Sunkenland had a rough early access launch, IMO. But the dev has made a lot of progress in the past 6 weeks weeks and seeing that progress made, I'm changing this to a positive review and I'm having a lot of fun playing. There's still rough spots, nothing game breaking that I've found and, IMO, the map needs to be larger and/or some sort of resource respawn (possibly tied in with enemies retaking islands). But it's a fun game and worth spending 20 bucks.

In 5 minutes, I found the following problems.
Poor graphics quality. Set to high on a RTX 3090
Can't remap keys.
Too much motion blur  and mouse movement is not smooth.
Excessive amounts of head bobbing when trying to cut down a tree or simply walk. 
Screen shaking for no apparent reason. 
Swim controls are buggy. You hit down once and continue to sink. No button to swim up, you have to keep hitting the jump button. 

In less then 5 minutes i had to quit because the screen was a bobbing blurry mess.

Edit: And no options to change fov, or turn off motion blur and/or head bobbing

Sunkenland is a survival game set in a waterlogged world that shows promise, but it's still in its early stages with room for improvement.

The game's premise includes modular base building on islands scattered throughout the ocean, sunken city scavenging, and confrontations with NPC clans for resources and territory. These elements come together to create a compelling survival experience in a waterworld setting.

The modular base building system on these islands is a notable highlight, allowing players to construct their shelters with ease. Nonetheless, there is room for expansion and added diversity in the available building options."

Exploring sunken cities provides a sense of adventure, although the storytelling aspect could be enhanced to make it more engaging.

While the crafting system serves its purpose, it might benefit from more complexity and variety to make it more engaging and rewarding.

Base defense and NPC clan invasions are meant to add excitement to the gameplay, but currently, they may not instill the sense of urgency or threat that one might expect. The AI adversaries lack the depth and challenge needed to make these encounters truly engaging.

In summary, Sunkenland is a survival game with potential. It offers a unique take on the waterworld theme through its modular base building, sunken city exploration, and resource-driven confrontations with NPC clans. With further development and adjustments, particularly in gameplay balance and storytelling, Sunkenland could become a more compelling entry in the survival game genre. Keep an eye on its progress; there's hope for its growth in the future.

I've got 100 hours in Sunkenland so far. I've enjoyed this game tremendously. It's been fun exploring. It's been fun defending against raids. Crafting is intuitive with well thought out levels of progression. The base building even has levels of progression. In just over a month on the market; the game has been getting steady upgrades - this is a good sign. The  developers have got something good here. I hope they stay on this path and continue to improve the game.

This is a very fun game to play with or without friends. Even though it's still in beta, there's lots you can do in this game. I do wish there were more creatures in the water and maybe caves to explore. Additional electricity features like solar panels and storage banks would be nice for longer lasting power. Besides the small tweaks and features as such, I still enjoy playing this game a lot. It has a great survival system and the attention to detail while exploring the water is incredible. A suggestion I have would be to potentially add a game mode for having allies/friends that you can trade with or have them get materials for you. Overall, would recommend trying this game out!

I sadly cannot recommend this game in it's current state.

Let me start by saying it's a fun concept a PVE Rust game but the current content is just so lacking, unbalanced and aimless. I can't recommend it for 20 bucks.

This game is just filled with time wasters to make you think you're actually having a lot of content but most of the time it's you emptying your boat and sorting it. Which damn is BAD.

You literally can press take all and it will BOOT EVERYTHING OUT OF YOUR CHEST if your inventory is full and just scatter everywhere. There is no quick stack. Some stacks are insanely small where others have so many.

This is a survival game but even with the highest survival settings we never struggled to stay alive with food and drinks except for the start! In the beginning you struggle with water and food but once you get a couple easily crafted guns you start finding so much soda and canned food you'll never have to cook or collect water again. This happens quite fast and basically takes away the survival aspect of the game.

Now progression is also an absolute disgrace. You start the PVE by making a bow and some arrows. You clear an island and continue to a crossbow and from here you can simply go to a higher island and play dirty with dying and respawning and just rushing back to finish island. ( Which if you pick random respawn u have a guarantee close spawn to the island. )

From that raid you get broken guns Deagle, rifles or shotguns and armor it's random you work for like 1-2h at most to fully get everyone a gun and some armor and it's literally over from there progression wise. You can clear almost every island easily and nothing really too look forward too besides some armor upgrades which are useless due to the respawn mechanic.

Most you got to look forward too after you get to that stage is to get the helicopter blueprint. Once you get that you spend 30m grinding iron and smelting it all to make a heli and the game is basically over..

Honestly I couldn't stomach more than 8h but continued to play because of my friends.

Pretty well fleshed-out for an Alpha game. happy to be a part of it. I like the concept a lot. Everyone is saying Rust x Raft which is... kiiinda true. No "real" pvp modes yet, but you can turn off map markers for other players, turn on friendly fire, and pick random respawns (though the random spawns don't always work and there's really only one inhabited island right as you start - though I'm expecting they'll add some PvP style settings in the future.
The underwater exploration is just as fun as ransacking NPC islands. Lots to craft, and I love the random decorations you find all over for your base - the things that at first you're like "this is just wasting pocket space" but then later you're like "I love this rubber ducky and I will die for him"
Looking forward to good things coming!

I am so impressed. love co-op survival/build craft games and this ticks all the boxes. It's like Raft x Rust. I LOVE the decorations you find to add to your base. I love the sound effects in the water when diving. I like that our base gets raided, it happens a lot (there are settings to change it). The combat is good too, some of the islands are hard to take over - and I still have a lot to complete. 

I'm SO looking forward to more updates, and to come back in ~6-12 months to play a new game.

For where it is now, it is incomplete and lacking in many things. Not to mention the constant game crashes sets you back a fair bit every time. Sunkenland seems to have been released TOO early and unfinished in my opinion proven by:

The reinforced structures are lacking: reinforced floor, roof, pillar, stairs, etc.
No method to upgrade walls/structures without removing them and building the next tier in its place, IF, you can even place it.(Personally I have a 3rd floor structure but even with pillar supports everywhere I cannot place any new walls where pre-existing walls are)
Tier 3 stuff is pretty much the last one you need as tier 4 unlocks very few useful items like the Heavy MG 'structure' or Raid Alarm(If you play with raids enabled)
Wood consumption on everything is fast and the same(No difference of the small grill to the improved grill--still burning the same amount of wood, just like for everything else with wood consumption)
Wood storage holds the same amount as ALL the other storage boxes, only difference is the LxWxH and HP by 100 or 200.
Battery drain for everything is fast.
O2 consumption from tanks is fast, even carrying around two full tanks is horrible.
Hunger/Thirst/Energy drain is fast.
Stack sizes are small.
Headlight doesn't have a bound-key to turn off/on making it rather useless to carry around.
The item descriptions are HORRIBLE. Even the Marine Fast Boat says it is "A wooden sailboat that can accommodate 4".

However, the game itself is stunning and seems to be a mix of Rust x Stranded Deep, would recommend it later when more is added and fixed to be playable AND enjoyable, but until then it's a pass.

This is a good game but it is a WORK IN PROGRESS. The base is there to show what it can be but there is still a long ways to go. So if you are not looking to support an Early Acess Project then consider waiting until the project is further along or complete.
Right now I have 12hrs in, I have explored much if not most of the map. There is a lot to see and do. Different enemy at different difficulty. Learn this before attacking. Mutants for example use primitive weapons spears, ax, crossbow. Slavers have firearms. So early on you would attack Mutants but stay away from Slavers. 

I hope the information above can help people to decide if this game is worth it. So many hate on EA games because they do not understand what you buy into. Please help the development by either waiting if you are not looking to support or buy into the project and help us all make it the best it can be.

Absolutely fantastic.
I love this game.

No 3rd person POV.   (If this makes you motion sick, the current dev answer is 'tough'.  They do have the ability to disable motion blur though so that is good.)
No mod support.  (I can think of no good reason for that other than someone who is a control freak heading up something.  While I personally do not mod I very much appreciate people who do so that we can customize the game.  Even modern MMO's allow a certain amount of modding and my guess is most will do this as a single player since there doesn't seem to be enough content to keep a group busy for long.  So, control freak.)

This is a game that screams for both of these things.  That and add a random world generator to be able to increase game time.  

Controls are fully re-bindable which is good but the game feels wildly unfinished.  I'm still working on playing it but for even a brief time in the game I'd say "Give this one a year or two to get 30% better before trying it."  If they add the ability for people to easily mod it, it might get better than that.  

Unfortunately it is another of the 'early access' plague of partially finished games unleashed upon the world and games take so long to make that we, the consumer, are desperate for new content - even if it is only partially done.  

As is, I'd give it a 5/10.

So here is my smallish review @ 20+ hours in. 

A solid 'base' of a game. At 20 bucks you will get more than your monies worth in time/energy/effort. All the major functionalities are here. Base building. Looting. Crafting. Combat. Another year of polish on this and this could be 'THE' game for the genre/setting to beat. 

It has the Waterworld meets Raft vibe down in spades. 

Pros - Ambiance (The world is enjoyable to explore). Crafting (Generic, but solid here in scope and application). Survival Mechanics (Food/Drink and health are balanced decently so your not spending 90% of your time looking for food/drink). Loot (varied enough for what is available now).

Cons - AI/NPC Combat (It really is just as bad as all the vids make it out to be). Very Limited Vendor/NPC interactions. Lack of anything resembling a story line. 

Does this game need polish, bug fixes, QoL improvements, etc.? You bet it does, but what it offers in Early Access is a solid entry into the genre with its own unique take. I mean, if you liked Raft, Scum and/or the movie Waterworld...then this is the game to play and support going into the future. The roadmap is ROBUST, to say the least (No way they are getting to ALL of it...more like 60% of it would be considered a 'Home Run' in development terms) and SO FAR, the Dev team is responsive, active and willing to listen. So, heres to the future!

The Devs did such a great job with this game! So many little details right. It's super fun! Best/fav survival game I've found yet. Kinda surprising that on the shoulders of the entire history of the genre, this small team can craft the Crown! Gg devs.
Big things, like every single POI being a custom designed map. Many needing a different strategy and pace. There's no CoD way of blowing thru these mobs, lol. 
Also that the key resources are not flowing into your pockets like rain. Makes you think, plan, pace, and work for the rewards. 
Cool little things like, the water level showing in the distiller, the analog dial gauge on the air pump, the subtle way each of the boats handles differently similar to irl.  
It's all really cool forethought, they've done a great job!

I saw this game's name first in a LetsGameItOut video thumbnail but didn't watch said video, but I looked up a playthrough of it and after two minutes of the person reading through the basics and explaining the premise (He described it as a mixture of Raft and Rust) I was sold, so I went to buy it.

5out of all the things that I like about the game, my favourite thing has to be how the sprint works.
If you tap the sprint button it acts like a toggle to sprint, but if you hold the sprint button it's like a hold to sprint.
I think this is (in my opinion) the best way to implement the sprint action.
And maybe the crouch as well now I think about it.

The only issue I have is the "loot all" key not being it's own thing, I've accidentally clicked E to exit a container only to have everything spill onto the floor, maybe have it so you cannot take any more items if your inventory is full?

One thing I can think of is I'd like a more granular key binding menu.
Maybe as a sub menu of the already existing one?
I.E. In "Primary interaction" the overall key could be whatever the default is, but you can click a dropdown menu for all the actions it relates to and change specific ones to something else.

Certainly seems like a nice time from what I've played so far, I'll definitely let my friends know about this.

Me and my girlfriend played the game for 15 hours in total, and I do have to mention that we didn't rush anything, just a casual, slow play. After the whole 15 hours of playing, we already finished up with the 4th stage of research table. We are kinda disappointed with how only 2 useful things unlocked at the very last part, and since it's the end game stage, we though we will unlock something much greater. I think we shouldn't be able to unlock the last stage so quickly.

After that, everything kinda fell off. We both didn't feel the need of playing the game anymore, since we knew there is nothing else to unlock, so why go further? We already had pretty much everything. 

Now to be a bit positive on the game. We loved the experience this game provides, raiding bases, collecting loot, trading, and the whole concept of having 50/50 land and underwater ruins to explore is such a great idea. We love this game, and we will return. I know it's early access, and that's the reason I will give positive review but there should be a lot of improvement, and I hope that devs will not quit on this game. 

The game is lacking content, even tho you have a lot to explore, you can end the game quickly. Guns are fine but enemies weapons are always stronger, and for some reason I need 3 headshot hits to kill Marauders, with the strongest sniper riffle! That didn't feel good at all but again, it's challenging. 

Loot respawn (more often) wouldn't hurt, or at least to have it as an option when you're creating the game. 
Overall, I do recommend this game to anyone that loves crafting, base building, exploring, guns, and looting. It's really a great game experience. Just don't expect much content inside, and after some time, you will ask yourself "What's the point?" and eventually, quit. 

Hopefully this helps! and to the developers, nice job, keep it up, i'll be watching for some new upcoming updates. Looking forward for more content.

So as far an an early access game goes, 10/10 I really hope they keep expending POIs and make it something incredible.

so far a really fun game. but i do have a few things that could improve the game for me and others

1. being able to decorate pre-existing buildings. i don't like how there are so many beautiful buildings and outposts that you can't really use because you can only build on player-made foundations and floors

2. reduce the enemy accuracy during the night or in the dark. whenever it gets dark i cannot see them at all, yet they can hit every single shot at me with no issues which bothers me.

3. i would love more decorations and stuff for the buildings in general, like wider windows. because as of writing this review there are only windows that are small bathroom-like windows, and a whole wall of glass. so more window variations would be lovely

4. seeing as there's a thing called "fine wood" as opposed to normal wood in the game. i feel like it would be cool if you could make fine wood foundations, floors, walls, etc. so that advanced players can have a bit more class in their base. 

5. speaking of base materials, i think concrete or cement walls, floors, etc would be the next logical step to base building and defense

6. there is no such thing as reinforced metal floors yet in the game, only foundations so far.

i hope these suggestions will help make this game better in the future :)

POTENTIAL. But has problems.

Pros: 
-Good concept, i love the waterworld idea, it's something different than the other survival games out.
-A.I. isn't the same every ranged or melee attacker you come across. Varying from hands to clubs, from crossbows to rifles.
-Resource management is nice, not eating 20 food items just to get hunger back up.
-Crafting is pretty straightforward and not difficult to grasp.
-Most materials are common enough, and more rare materials aren't that hard to find.
-Some of the more necessary things such as paddle boat aren't that hard to get materials and make.
-For the most part structures snap together pretty well.
-Graphics look pretty well considering.

Cons:
-Diving up and down(although i'm sure this is for early game) for resources gets redundant pretty quick.
-Food, so you don't need 20 foodstuffs for hunger, but for healing you need quite a bit as heal items seem pretty scarce.
-A.I. raids IMMEDIATELY destroy anything and everything in seemingly record time, and you MUST have walls and ALWAYS go to defend, no matter how far you are, period.
-Research then build, mats to unlock, mats to make, LOT of materials required.
-Building is off on a few things, i.e. roofing somehow doesn't match up correctly to build? ladders/stairs are one size, that's it.
-Building health, definitely too low considering most of the time even if I was at the base from start of A.I. raid, they go DIRECTLY to destroying my stuff, why?
-Cannot upgrade from wood to metal, nor reinforce or upgrade existing wood or metal, considering A.I. 75% of the time drawn to structures, why not have this?
-Hitboxes(both for yourself and A.I.) seems wonky, best I can describe it, sometimes hit nearby objects, sometimes i don't, sometimes getting hit from pretty far (not a varying attack pattern issue), sometimes not.

 The best I can say for this game at the moment. So the overall game isn't that bad and compared to a lot of early access games price for what you get. If you want a new take on a survival game for relatively cheap, not a bad way to go, this is pretty good. However, its got some issues. Found dealing with A.I. early game is quite a nuisance.

Side note: not sure if its my TV or settings, but definitely had some screen tearing issues in the middle of my screen horizontally, just seemed to be a constant thing, don't know why. PC has good specs, more than enough for this.

I've played this game with a friend for about 20 hours and while I enjoyed it a lot at the beginning, there's not a lot of content to keep us going. We built a base, did some research, made boats and guns and sailed out to the edge of the map. There are no game breaking bugs but there are few small annoying ones, like getting stuck in underwater structures and drowning. After raiding a few islands from different factions, it all got pretty samey and there doesn't seem to be much potential for progression. There's no real storyline to uncover. The mechanics are fairly simple and easy to master.  The map is not really huge and every island and faction is pretty much the same as all of the others, so exploration is not really a thing.  It has potential to be a good game but I wish I'd waited a year to find out whether they plan to do anything interesting with the world they've created.

Overview: 
Overall, the game itself is a cool concept. It boasts a broad concept and a real good crack at it at that.
Open world esk, sea-survival with elements of factions and PVE action, along side wildlife. Free-style building with little to no restrictions on where you can build and hold up against the enemies as you progress.

Progression is a slow but manageable pace, loot pools being a mix of good and basic items allows for some really good pulls early on if you are lucky. Overall the simplicity is what makes it fun, it doesn't require a vast extensive knowledge to get the hang of the game in a short time.

I hope the infinite generation comes to fruition, at the time of writing this 10/1/23 still Isn't a thing just yet.
But with loot respawns and stuff it makes exploring worth and even if its fully explored you have a chance to re-get loot.

Controller support is huge, not a controller player, but I have some homies who are, and its nice to have a game that supports both.

The Cons:
Well as with any early access game there is going to be cons, at the moment its mostly weird bugs for me, but overall the rest of the game is pretty smooth with a few weird hitches here and there.

Most noteable bugs being, some buildable objects act as ladders on the corner allowing you to climb up it, including NPCs. 

Demolition hitboxes for objects and where your actually looking is abit skewed and doesnt exactly demo what you want. 

Some of the defense objects don't damage npcs, wall-spikes not always working.

But honestly other than that its been a pretty nice time, id give it an 8/10 overall. Worth the 20$ if you have some time and money to spare.
