I've really enjoyed playing this so far! Dying during combat is pretty forgiving (you just have to pick up your resources from where you last died, and you can either respawn at your bed OR in a random spot; random spot is best when you aren't at your base and are somewhere else fighting or something), and gathering items is really easy. The only thing I'm not a HUGE fan of is that you can't move anything once you've placed it, and demolishing it only gives you back so many resources (not even half of what you used to build/create it). Over all, love the gameplay so far and it's a lot of fun!

Great game, entertaining and fun to play with or without friends but needs some polishing. Not very much content but i dont expect much since its a new released game and EA but regularly patches which is a good sign. Some stuff needs to be changed, like option to respawn enemies and most items. Would like to see more types of food, food source/animals, materials and weapons as well. Also put copper ingot to good use like creating wires or pipes. Please add more type of metals and combinations like brass. Would like to see maybe sinks, heat radiators and walls. Would love to see more types of electricity generators, solar panels, wind or water turbines. Also please change the energy output on artifact lamps (those you find in chests), they are like 100 per unit and its such a waste to have it connected to a generator, drains your gasoline tanks. Having lamps connected to a generator shouldn't cost that much power, its crazy unrealistic (including the head lamp which drains power insanely fast). You got to change the measurements unit for how fast the boats goes. Its ridiculous, a wooden boat goes above 100 kmph is just laughable. Rating: ★★★★★

Sunkenland is an absolute gem in the survival and exploration genre, and I can't get enough of it in its current state. If you're a fan of this genre, do yourself a favor and dive right in!

One of the standout features for me has been the absence of tool deterioration. It's such a relief not having to constantly worry about the state of my tools while I'm out exploring this breathtakingly submerged world. This means more time for adventure and less time for maintenance, and I'm all for it!

Speaking of adventure, there is an absolute wealth of things to craft and explore in Sunkenland. From building your dream base in unique locations to crafting various tools, weapons, and even vehicles, the possibilities seem endless. It's a crafting enthusiast's dream come true!

But what truly gets my heart racing is the thrilling base defense against the menacing mutants. The adrenaline rush as they raid your base is an absolute blast. It keeps you on your toes and adds a level of excitement to each game session that's hard to match. Sunkenland truly knows how to keep you entertained.

In summary, Sunkenland is a must-play for anyone who enjoys post-apocalyptic survival and exploration games. With tool durability out of the picture, a world of crafting and exploration at your fingertips, and the constant excitement of mutant raids, it's an experience you won't want to miss. Jump on board, dive deep, and prepare for a journey you won't soon forget!

It's a good idea, and I'm sure later content might be interesting, but starting out it was just another boring loot sim.

Hoping to revisit in 6-8 months, will update my review then.

For an Early Access Game Sunkenland has a ton of potential! I have almost 32 hours in and this game is very fun and addicting! I have already explored every part of the map and have crafted alot and it seems like it will be an even better game with more updates! The only really tough bug is when you have spent hours gathering resources and then you save the game and come back in and all of your resources are gone from your chests other than that great job developers on an amazing game. I'll list some pros and cons below so other players know what to expect from this game...

Pros:
-Graphics are really good
-Very easy game to learn
-Menus are easily navigated
-Crafting is super easy
-Aim and Shoot mechanism is on point
-Driving/Flying mechanic is very easy and smooth
-All around a fun game to play with friends

Cons:
-Resources become scarce and hard to find once you have crafted so much....(Iron Ore and Copper Ore) I feel like there should be more resources available in the world and on the different islands that you travel to
-Resources gathered sometimes disappear from chests after you save the game and load back in (PLEASE FIX!)
-The sharks can kiss my A$$ for sure
-Not alot to explore after about 20 hours into the game but that will definitely change with future updates I'm sure
-Chests, Vehicles, Backpack and Shelves should hold more items it feels like there is not alot of room in any of them and I have about 25 metal shelves, 15 wooden shelves, 10 chests, and the largest backpack you can craft and I feel like I'm constantly running out of room and I craft alot
-The recoil on the guns in the game definitely needs to be tweaked and reduced a bit especially on the AK... It kicks like a mf

Other than these few cons this is all around a fun and well put together game! Great Job Developers!

Not for the casual player. 24 hours on normal difficulty (approx 40 days+ game time?)  and it becomes impossible. By the time you figure out the dynamics and research tree, build a decent base, and start advancing, its too late. Constant attacks by enemies with heavy weapons, when you may have flintlocks and pistols, undoes everything. If you spend any time exploring and/or base building rather than aggressively seeking out weapons development (assuming  you knew to do that from the start) you wont get anywhere. The most frustrating factor is the time it takes to repair structures, and the fact cold water at night has no effect on enemies, but they'll will kill you and destroy everything you spent hours building in no time. Haven't played at other skill level besides normal, and not sure I want to until there is some serious re-balancing at that level.

This game is a survival Looter Set against a flooded city landscape that makes you swim for most loot with a limited amount of air.  Upgrades such as, Foot Paddle boats, sail boats, diving foot fins, ETC.  will help you in all aspects of these limitations.  Ironically I was thinking to myself how come no one has started a Stranded Deep type game?  Literally that night i found this gem.  If you like looting and building and surviving almost exactly like Stranded Deep then you will LOVE this game.  Even in early beta I can tell ill be playing the Hell out of this game.  Yea its got its beta type bugs but what do you expect.  I am not an easy person to please as far as survival loot games go and i think this one had potential.  ONLY negative so far is the janky ghouls that come out at night....  The artwork on those could definitely use a redo.  But if that's all i can complain about, you must try this game if you like Survival Looters with a beautiful tropical backdrops.

The game requires you to go out and search monuments to get resources that will never respawn again once you loot them. 

The Dev team introduced a bug that cleared out boxes of loot from people's world rendering the save file with my friends absolutely useless. I asked on their discord if they QA test their patches before releasing them and they said "Our community QA tests our builds and this wasn't a problem that was found." Yet after their update that broke thousands of people worlds, their discord was full of people like myself having completely useless game files. They have offered the ability to send in your save file to get your items "Restored". 

Regardless, if you are an indie game Dev company or a AAA title company, regression testing your builds should be apart of every release. Don't rely on community members to do an actual QA member's job.

I absolutely love this game. Just bought it and played like 10 hours straight through. Survival crafting games are my favorite genre and Sunken Deep and Raft are two of my favorite games of all time so this one is right up my alley when it comes to games. It is definitely early access though but the developer communicates their planned road map right at the beginning of the game and seems to have a plan. Highly playable and enjoyable in it's current state. Edit: Devs are definitely doing Early Access right. They listen to their playerbase and address issues and bugs quickly with frequent updates. As of this edit (9/16/23) we are still in very early access so expect that you'll have to restart relatively often as updates break old saves though you can always use Steam's beta function to play older versions if you're particularly attached to a save.

My wishlist for the Devs.

1. Please, oh please, let us hold down the left click to harvest resources rather than clicking multiple times. It just saves wear and tear on the mouse button and not to mention avoiding repetitive stress injures. 

2. There needs to be a way of picking up building pieces and furniture after they've been set down, even if it means destroying them and only getting a fraction of the materials back. Some sort of blueprint system like in The Forest or an upgrade system like in 7D2D would be ideal. 

3. Having containers in the world remain so they can be reused for storage rather than breaking apart would be nice.

Otherwise, this is a very solid start and I'm excited to see where this game goes. I feel a lot like when I first picked up 7D2D back in early 2014. I knew it was something special back then and I have that same feeling for Sunkenland.

Quick PSA to players looking for the gear/cog item:
I can't remember the name I read this "fix" from (sorry in advance), however if you leave one item in the red toolboxes you get the gear/cog item from then they will re spawn all the loot in them. Helps a ton until we get a balance fix for them.

So far I haven't seen any of the negative claims anyone in reviews/discussions have mentioned other than a few minor bugs. I don't believe this studio are scammers and I haven't experienced any hackers getting into a closed game.

Bugs encountered so far (Will try to update as things get fixed and destroyed):
- 1 lost Heli after landing it on water.
- Getting stuck in roofs/poles while diving.

Some advice to the studio:
Please see the gold mine of a game you're sitting on at the moment. You have the makings of what could be a pretty great title, don't let it go into the abyss like a lot of other small E.A. title go. Work hard, take time off for yourself when needed but always keep your community updated. Communication goes a very long way with games like yours.

Communication is key.

You won't be able to make everyone happy unfortunately. So keep making this game in your vision but never hesitate to seek out ideas/advice from your community. A lot of people seem to really want this game to do well, myself included.

Best of luck to your studio and I hope to see this become something remarkable. :praisesun:

The game has potential and I want to support it but here are my 2 cents if the developers care to listen.  Where is the marine life?. sharks, Marlins a few fish. How bout Corals and more fish whales giant squid etc. Submarines are better than boats or gyro-copters this thing sucks cannot fly it. A diving suit resistant to cold with tanks, could be very nice and is very common in today's world. Guns with no attachments, only one useless dotted scope. Long range scopes flash lights simple things.  Can i get a boat with a mounted machine gun?.  Most blue prints suck the fast speed boat is very good.  the repair hammer is acceptable early game but late game with a large base you got to be kidding. Just a few ideas that will make this game stay alive for a while and be enjoyable. More Islands, more bad guys around more fish, more weapons better transportation.  Keep up the good work.

I can't wait for the finished version. Awesome game so far. Updates are making the game better all the time. AI's are some of the best in any game I've played. Despite being early access its rather enjoyable to play with friends but it does need some work to get it to a place where people will enjoy it more.

The further you get in the more you notice how rough it is around the edges but you accept it as its still fun, I think many people expect something super polished with some of these early access games.
In my opinion the game needs lots of work to make it more enjoyable.  Content is a little lacking and most outposts despite differences you start to notice are the same.  

Npc's can be formidable and sometimes land some crazy shots on you, shooting can literal hit and miss.  I feel that some of the guns need work in the way they shoot or recoil and hit shots.  Graphics are typical unity engine stuff, with the game looking very much like Rust.

Loot system is quite decent, you seem to find what you need eventually without much effort.  The crafting system I like as its simple to understand and learn as is the user interface for this.  Inventory system is quite nice, could do with a little polishing but its fine to interact with.

Base building and snapping of some items needs work.  There is so much scope for the possibilities of what could be achieved with this with patches and of course community input for what is desired/needed.

Map feels on the small side once you get to the faster transport vehicles.  You find yourself quickly destroying enemies at outposts and doing super quick loot runs.
More references to the movie waterworld would be nice lol.

Of course I have plenty of gripes with the game but so far so good, the biggest one for me was the ability for individuals to randomly enter your game world despite passwords, kicking them works fine though.  I have experienced some issues with ingame storage but I'm confident bugs and glitches like this will be addressed by the game devs.  
I do feel that some things could be done now quickly to make the game better, dedicated servers would be a big one and maybe adding pvp as an option.  
Well I look forward to seeing what content will be added in the future and how the game will progress.  It certainly feels worthy of its current price tag and to spend time on and importantly the devs seem very active in developing the game in to something great.

This 'Waterworld' game is extremely intriguing and fun and I can't wait to see what the developers come up with in the near future.

A few honest observations:

The humanoids with military-grade ranged weapons are extremely difficult with their bottomless supply of ammo and you have zero chance to sneak past these freaks or evade their spray and pray gun fire.

The food and water consumption is set a little too high as you will spend all your early game time purifying water and cooking food just to sustain yourself. This is extremely boring and very unrealistic. A human can fill up their stomach and live perfectly fine for days, so why does this game require that I eat and drink every 20 minutes or face sudden demise? (*Update-This got much better as I wore insulated clothing, suffering less cold effects, and this requiring less water/food.)

Crafting stations, forges, and plant Potters need to allow multiple stacks of items to be placed in them at a time and there needs to be a queing system. Currently you can ONLY place one resource item or seed at a time and are forced to endure a lengthy amount of time before they can be harvested. This is extremely tedious and unproductive. I would prefer to drop a stack in them and let them craft/cook while I continue to travel and gather additional resources.

While sailing, you are forced into a first person perspective and the ship's giant sail blocks almost all of your view, making navigating the map extremely cumbersome and unenjoyable. Please either remove the sail from our view or set the orbiting camera view farther out so that players can better navigation.

This game requires a feature that allows players the ability to annotate their map and a feature to rename our beds. Having several beds, located around the map is impossible to tell which one and from where on the map to spawn from whenever you die. This is extremely frustrating.

So far, this game requires an extraordinary amount of time and effort looting but I suppose later game will become easier in this regard as I acquire more advanced technology blueprints.

Great work so far on this enjoyable game!

Given the current content and the current price, i [b]cant recommend[/b] the game. At the same time, giving it a thumbs down seemed a bit harsh. So betting on the future of the game, i'll give it a [b]thumbs up[/b]. For now, grab it on a sale or wait for the devs to improve the game. So far the devs made a good impression, as they are constantly working on the game and releasing rapid fixes. I will focus the rest of my review on constructive feedback for the devs, which can also serve to give the average reader insight on the weaknesses of the game.

For context, we played the game as a 2-player coop on hard difficulty.

[b]Exploration:[/b]
We tried to get 100% exploration on all the islands. While i wont deny that it's possible we missed some items, we are used to combing areas like that very thoroughly, even multiple times. Some islands we couldnt get above 95-98% and the starting island is stuck at a pathetic 86%. We are pretty sure that there is some bug preventing 100%ing most locations, like items being invisible / unreachable. We found at least one such unreachable item (a locker) in one of the city center towers, where you could not get to it.
The exploration itself was fun, except that you (we) basically completed the game after 40% of islands or so. While there was like 2 meaningful blueprints to be found on the remaining islands, these felt overwhelmingly pointless. 
I wish there was a way to highlight what you are missing after reaching like 95% completion, as well as something unique to each island which served as a motivation to go out and explore after completing the tech tree. The distribution of items is also horrible. We had about 20 barrels full of scrap at the end, and nothing to do with it, yet after looting literally the entire game, we did not have enough advanced components for a second helicopter after ours simply vanished. 

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
Getting as close to 100% as humanly possible, the game took us under 30 hours to complete. That said, only maybe 10 - 15 hours of those were fun. That was when we were through the part of the game which felt meaningful and then continues to grind completion, for the sake of it, which felt unrewarding and at times frustrating. 
There is some balancing issues with items too. Battey based items feel underwhelming, like all of them. At some point we crafted the headlamp, i put it on, and in the 5 seconds it took me to try and turn it off ('L' did nothing, by the way), it already lost 10% charge or so. We put it into a chest and never bothered with it again afterwards. 
It is a bit stressful how much your gameplay is dictated by ingame (day) time. Most of the exploration is underwater, and you simply wont be able to thoroughly search the area unless it's daytime. So basically you plan everything around getting out of base at sunrise, which did not feel very good. This is not helped by the bed having a, what feels like, 24 hour timer, so each time you use it your sleeping time shifts backwards. It would also be great if you woke up in the morning, not after a fixed duration. As is, the bed felt basically useless for the majority of days, either because we couldnt sleep when we needed to, or because we would wake up at a useless time. 
The waves that attack you scale to become waaay too strong. Sure, we played on the harder difficulties, but you get raided by 20 or so people with guns, which can kill you in just a few shots with the best equipment in the game. To add insult to injury, we got spawncamped at two points in the game, literally being oneshot directly after leaving the bed. The new armor system, where armor breaks and leaves you effectively naked (armor wise), didnt really help with that. We had to reload the game, which as of now despawns the attackers. This is likely a bug, but before you fix it, keep in mind that our only other solution would have been to start from scratch, and leave a negative review. 
There is also this insanely annoying bug where ranged weapons simply cant hit enemies anymore. This can happen to both hosts and clients independantly or at the same time and we are not sure what causes it. As melee combat becomes useless lategame, you have to restart.

[b]Repairing:[/b]
This feature is so bad, it deserved its own category. Im not even kidding. A wall has 2500 to 4000 HP. You repair 100 HP per hit, so have fun hitting a broken wall up to 40 times. Per wall. If you can hit it, at all, given the range of the hammer being half an arms length or so. Forget about repairing stuff you cant directly stand in front of. If you want to repair something you stand on, better crouch down lol. Have fun even figuring out what took damage in the first place, since you can only see HP values in a slightly larger range than you can hit stuff. The whole system is ridiculous and felt so bad we stopped repairing stuff and just lived with everything slowly breaking apart. 
Gameplay over realism. Give us a green-to-red HP overlay for build items. Give the hammer like 5 meters of range. Make it (out of combat) repair 1000 HP a hit. Nobody likes to repair their base. Make it as painless as possible, not as frustrating as possible.

[b]Clothes:[/b]
The game offers a large amount of clothes. Which would usually be a good thing. But since you care about armor only, all players will look pretty much the same in endgame. Nobody will wear an anime t-shirt, if something else warms them in the night or gives them more armor. Separate armor from looks. Let us wear vanity over the armor items.
The amount of clothes and trophy items is also increadibly overwhelming, especially considering the inventory problems. Even just looting and then throwing the stuff away (directly in place) is annoying, as there is no hotkey. The clothes and trophy items should simply be unlocked, never ending up in your inventory, to then be placeable indefinitely, or be equippable without consuming them, from some wardrobe. Something like that. 

[b]UI & Interaction:[/b]
Needs improvements. The main menu to host a previously saved session has such a bad user experience, it feels bugged. While attempting to host an existing map, it does not highlight the map name, and the "New World" button has to be selected. I mean.. why? First time i relaunched the game i wasnt sure if i was just about to overwrite our existing save, or start a new game. Horrible design. 
The ingame UI is a bit better, but some of the interactions are horrid. To split an item you need to drag it into a specific "inventory splot" and then use a slider to split the stack. And you cant even do this while it's in a chest. A horrible experience, which is not helped by how often you will do this. 
Inventory management itself is a bit annoying, especially considering we had to regularly visit locations at least 2 times, in 2-player coop to loot them approximately 100%. This means you'd have to go there 3-4x in singleplayer. And vehicles are kinda.. slow. 
The helicopter controls are nightmare-inducing. No, really. In over 20 years of gaming i have never seen such a horrible control concept. As a fellow software engineer and hobby game dev, i dont think i could make up worse controls, even if i tried. Since the mouse controls the stick which leans the helicopter in some direction for steering, you cant move the camera. This means you simply stare directly ahead.. so most of the time you have no idea if you are level in the air, or leaned in some direction. Not to mention you cant see where you land. Even if that was not the case, the mouse-to-stick controls dont feel fun. Just horrible. Rework ASAP.

[b]Other Suggestions:[/b]
After the dust settles and the core gameplay is fixed and fun, id love to be able to customize the gameplay a bit. Some sort of skill tree would be great. Also, backpacks that specialize in certain roles, by being able to store tons of low-volume low-weight items like cloth, or miner-backpacks that allows to have way larger ore stacks.

I highly recommend it. Just my two cents, but the interface menus and building mechanics were easy enough to work out. I really liked the ability to turn off raids so you can enjoy working on your base at leisure and learn at your own pace, and then decide whether you want to challenge yourself more. Hunting sharks was a bit tricky at first but once ya get the hang of it they're easy peasy. I don't particularly have any real complaints since it's early access and the devs seem to be very responsive and quick to improve the gameplay, I'd love to see things like whales and dolphins added as well as other creatures. Maybe dolphins get curious and play around you as you scavenge, or whales look really imposing but generally do their own thing. Seeing their waterspouts or tale flukes would be a spectacular addition. I'd love to see differing weather conditions, which would give tremendous immersion. And of course new maps and so on, which I have no doubt will be added as soon as possible. As I said the devs seem to be very responsive and mindful, which I find quite refreshing for a change.
Can't wait to see the game as it evolves. It's hugely entertaining for a solo player like me. You can tone down the NPC raids to suit your abilities, and base-building is so much fun!

Its a fine game, but it has a problem with losing all your stored items upon updates and in order to fix that you need to read a one page guide the devs put up and revert to older versions. If youre up for that its a decent game. Losing your progress is one of the most unfun things in a game. I understand early access but im supposed to play it and chill not having to work through the same stuff after just 1 hour of gameplay.
could use some work and more controller support i.e chopper is useless with a controller.. but other then that its a fun game if you like these kind of games
good

Great early access game. If you like Survival games (Rust, The Forest, Stranded deep, Subnautica) and the movie Waterworld, you'll love it.

Of course, there are bugs, it's very early access, but it's still fun and immersive already. Ignore all the muppets crying about things that aren't perfect, they have no idea what early access means and can only think about themselves. I'm 4 hours in, I haven't bugged once, but I know it will come because I never played a game that didn't bug and I like helping to test and make things better.

Buy the game and help the devs by reporting bugs, sending save files, copying error messages, and explaining exactly what happened before the problem started. Use video and screenshots. The game will be better for it. 

Looking forward to seeing what new updates bring. Hoping for open sea clan warfare like the Waterworld movie, huge seabase raids, and cruising around on a catamaran with a kite sail that I can shoot from a harpoon for extra speed to get away from the smokers on jetskis...

I think this game has huge potential, actually huge! Buy it and help make it great.

The name is shit though. So many better alternatives. 'Salt' 'Deep' 'Brine' 'Tide' 'Blue' 'Seascape' 'Mariana' ... I mean, Sunkenland.... come on <3

love it, addicted only thing is the mutants are way to strong, I haven't even got working guns, yet theres 10 of them with guns i dont really see how that is fair because they 1 shot me and i cant kill them obviously if i dont have guns

Absolutely love the game, been streaming it with some friends. We really want it to grow and do well I have video for reference if need be also.
|
- Chests : At one point one chest bugged out and became unusable until broken. Cause : someone is occupying this storage.

- Motor Boat (2 seater) : Friends joining server experienced getting stuck in boat driver seat unable to hop out. Fix : Have them log out and in.
We also both got stuck at one point in the same seat. Not sure if this was the cause but when we both saved and logged out and started again. The boats had "dissapeared" and EVERY I mean ALL items in any form of storage was completely wiped even though all our recent progression was there. A LOAD of items I'm not sure how they got beside the base in a ring shape.  lots of iron, vests not sure if related to disappearance of all our items and maybe it was trying to render ours in, I am really not sure but i have footage of the struggle. Went for a swim to find our boats near the edge of the map with also my fish net?. Very unusual experience haha but had fun nonetheless! (can go into more detail if required).

- Server bugs possibly : Friends claimed they could see my server on the public list the first time they ever joined. But when they left they had to be invited. Not a major issue.

- Enemies : I didn't witness this myself, One of my friends said apparently one of the mobs ran through a tree.

- Swimming : Friend stated was swimming up under house, somehow popped through and spawned in roof and drowned.

SUGGESTIONS
|
- Claiming Land
- Recycling clothes to get like cloth maybe
- Skin from enemies to make leather
- Grills fit more food maybe since they are so big. or create a cheaper smaller option.
- Tribes\Guilds\Factions of our own, So that only friends can use your stuff. even a trust system. would also fix false alarm home raids.
- Servers that we can buy and host if the company doesnt have its own servers yet. some people are willing to pay to host their own.
- Mic visual in game when other people talk with name beside (proximity?)
- A couple of extra enemies under water or just more sea life. good suggestion. some bigger models like whales and mantarays to save on having too many things.
- Upgradeable Buildings so yoou dont have to destroy. Being able to move things in general or just pick them back up. Bigger storage?

PS: Thank you for the game, it has been an amazing experience so far. We are all looking forward to what's to come! This message was meant with all kind regards in hopes this game will do well.

Sincerely,
NamelessVoodoo

Incredibly fun game, but if you are easily irritated do not attempt to play until polished further. So far the main issue we have had was a hacker getting into our private server, but after dropping the player count to 2 EVERY TIME you load it up it has been fine. Just keep that in mind. Thankfully haven't had to deal with most of the other save bugs dealing with item loss and what not. I cannot wait to see where this goes ⸜(｡˃ ᵕ ˂ )⸝♡
its a fun adventure every time you go out looting

fun game
fun and runs really well for being a beta and i cant wait to see what they do/add
trash
I cant get enough of the game! i Love the graphics and just everything about it! Only thing i hate is whoever makes the server has to be logged on in order for others to play on that said server!

Great game for early access, has a 7 Days to Die "feel" to it, but under water and plenty of on land fun to be had too! Plays great, very interesting and varied POI's and the AI seems legit and well balanced, smart but not godlike. The devs are listening to player feedback and working hard to make improvements and balance on a weekly, if not daily basis.
This game has a solid foundation already and is off to a great start, looking forward to seeing this one reach its full potential.  Already worth the $ in my opinion if you like survival/base building.
is like stranded deep but in steroids
Fun.
It's keeping my interest for sure.  I love the underwater world. Can't wait to see what else the devs have in mind for the hopefully not to distant future. :)
its like a coop rust/raft mix with weekly updates, cant get better than that.
darn this game it took or my stuff stripped me naked and dump me into the ocean after i saved and exited to go to bed,
Unbelievable potential here. Super fun game so far in early development o7

The game is good ,when you can get it to start but after installing the latest update I can't start the game . I press the play button on my Steam library an the first thing to come up is a warning box that saved game data may be lost unless you go back to old version. This warning box has an OK button at the bottom which seems to glitch on and off when the cursor is over it ! Then it stays highlighted for a while or just freezes there , causing me to close the game with task manager. If it gets passed this to the select player/create game box it freezes there once again having to force game to shut down. This is very disappointing as I've already stated that the game ran fine and is good if you get it to start. Hope they properly sort it out and I will recommend it but until then I can't  :-(.

26 hours into this game.  Good stable game play.  Good progress in the game itself.  Really enjoying the game.  And then.....my base is attacked by what I would describe as invincible attackers.  There was not a thing I could do to even attempt to thwart the assault.....after repeatedly thwarting every single assault prior to that.  Sure felt like my single player world and experience was hacked.  Now the game is unstable, and any new worlds (single player) I create will not run without glitches or even save progress.  I guess its time to uninstall and put this game in my rear view mirror.  Vector 3 Studios:  very disappointed in your work here (and security) for what first appeared to be a great early release game.  Not sure I will purchase from you again.  Other gamers and buyers, beware.....hopefully your experience is better than mine.  Sad day.

I really like how this game is developing. It still has a few bugs and quirks, but as an early access game is, this game is really stable and worth at least trying. The multiplayer option, so early on, is really good also.
It is what it says it is and it is definitely worth the money. If you like games like Rust or Dayz then you will for sure enjoy this. JUST GET IT
Love this game so far, can't wait until it is finished!

Really like this game. Yes it is early access and there are a few bugs, but the developers are doing a fantastic job at keeping the updates coming and fixing the major issues in the game. Bravo. Great game and lots of fun.

In its current state this game is basically an unplayable clone of RUST with 90% water. Way to many broken things to make play enjoyable. Its currently plagued: by hackers  / grievers, Save issues, and Building bugs. This should go back to Alpha testing, not EA.

I'm new to PC gaming and after watching a few videos on this game i took the leap and it was a fantastic decision, Early access game with a progressive road map, plentiful updates fixing bugs that the growing community are pointing out. Game has a great concept! Needs more content which is on the way, frequent updates make this game promising to play for the foreseeable future. Really fun game so far, the combat with guns feels like a mix of far cry 2 and legacy rust, which is a good thing. I like that enemies don't respawn on their islands, but you can still have your base attacked at any time so the challenge never goes away. The armours are really cool, they give off mad max feels. The base building is cool, very post apocalyptic. There is so much potential for this game and I can't wait to see where it goes. The developers do regular bug fixes and improvements so it's looking promising.

Really enjoying the game experience. I have played a lot of Stranded Deep, Infected, Mist, Subnautica, 7 Days to Die, etc. and I rate this Early Access Game up there as a really good start.  The day and night cycle is way too short.  Growing food is way too easy to the point of immersion breaking. I see other players complaining that inventory space is too small.  I don’t mind so much, but I do wish the vehicles (boats) has more containers or upgradability.  I have only 24 hours into the game so far, but there is a lot here for a EAG that was just released.  I am looking forward to see more content and more sea life…seems a bit sparse and the patterns seem too predictable.  But Kudos to the developers. Great job Vector3 Studio!
Fun game, lots of exploration.... :-)

I think we've got the beginnings of a good thing here. It's a bit bare-boned at present, but the combination of Sunkenland's unique setting and familiar survival genre mechanics bodes well for the future. I look forward to watching it evolve, and don't regret throwing a few bucks the developers' way as part of the early access.

I swear this game on paper should be a failure. Its a mix bag of mechanics and features from various survival games like Raft, Rust, The Forest, and more. YAY for new game bugs!  LOL

Seriously though, what new title doesn't have bugs?  Its why we are in early access, to find them en mass.  We buy the game at a reduced cost with the understanding that it is far from finished, and we are here to help the development of what will eventually become a polished game.

This isn't my 1st rodeo with these types of early access, but why I am choosing an early endorsement of this game specifically?  The reactions of the dev team as we grind through early game growing pains together compel my up-votes.  They are paying attention.  They are active.  They are responsive.  You may not like a response, but that is never part of the deal. 

This game is entertaining.  It is enjoyable... and most of all it has a lot of potential.  Considering how badly Snail Games has screwed the customer base lately, this is a refreshing option for new builder possibilities.  

Devs: PLEASE consider allowing open modding in the steam workshop once this game comes to a satisfactorily stable condition in your eyes, as this title could easily overtake take the place of Rust or Raft.  The ideas and opportunities you could open up for this game and your studio by allowing the minds of the players to contribute is invaluable to both the enjoyment of the game and its resell value in the future.  I love what I see so far and I want to see this title last for a long time.

2 snaps up in Z formation.
fun game , something new, loot and build , defend !
This game is incredibly fun! i have had minimal issues with it. I love the crafting mechanics and eagerly look forward to seeing how the developers move forward with the game!

it doesnt seem like enemies or resources other than trees replenish which means once you hit all the islands and finish all the PvE theres nothing left to do.

there is no real story line yet but that is said to come in later updates.

this game has great potential, it is very fun with the limited amount of content it has, im excited to see what happens with it next.


EDIT: 

a few things i can think of adding 

1. better night/day cycles. a lot of the time its too dark to do anything or it is too cold if you can do anything the daytime isn't long enough to actually be able to do full tasks. but i still have to wait a while before i can skip the night.

2.renewable resources

3.traders that have a cycling inventory

4. when doing "take all"  with chests not to have everything dump on the floor that doesnt fit in inventory

Okay overall is good but when ever i crafted a fucking armor like spetznas helmet and armor its just dissapear on next day even its just recently builded, CMON I WANNA CLAIM REFUND OF MY ARMOR BRO ITS HARD TO GET SPECIAL FORCES ARMOR ;/

The UI is super clunky. Now I could have gotten past this, but throw onto it game breaking bugs like "Someone is Occupying" and I just couldn't do it. How does the game lock my party out of the resources that we just gathered because the chest is bugged? Unacceptable for a $20 game.
loved it very much, I like surviving games!

For a game that seems to be in alpha state there is alot to do. You can easily see the potential the game has and i hope to see it till the end. For 20 USD your getting a solid amount of gameplay. So far the only bad things i have encountered outside of coop is the buggy enemy ai and the upside down turtles. As for co-op it has similiar issues has The forest had when its multiplayer came out with desyncing and disconnection of the non host. It doesn't happen often enough to cause frustration. Between current content and the potential the roadmap shows 20 dollars is a good buy.
All we need in this now is the Smoker Clan, Dennis Hopper and the game is essentially a much deserved Waterworld movie to game experience. Awesome setting and the devs are really on it with feedback!

This game is buggy as hell the 1 type of fish just swim in a circle the sharks do the same. the ai is horrible for the people that shoot or have swords? and the loot system constantly says someone else is occupying the chest pretty much like a loot sim but you cant put anything in the box because its laggy if you can move like a snails speed the game is perfect for you.

This game is like Stranded Deep, but actually good...

Jokes aside, though, there are some optimization issues and some bugs. Nothing game-breaking, though. There are some systems that need to be streamlined as well, but the dev team seems to be very active and they are taking the game in the right direction. It IS early access, and feels like it. That being said, it is fun and I can't ask for more than that from a game. As long as the team stays proactive and continues to progress in the manner that they have been, this game will continue to be fun for hours to come.

Cant wait to see more maps, even if they are randomly generated and make no sense it would be nice to start a new world no one knows the layout of in multi play

Love this game, has all the survival things I would like in a game. For sure it needs polishing and needs to get some Q.O.L. things added (and there adding loads as we go already, to name 2: packing box and stackable storages), I'dd love to see added is a upgrade hammer, to upgrade foundations and walls etc. (like in Rust), but a part from that it's an amazing and fun game to play. Replayable for sure, especially if Dedicated Servers comes into play, but then the map has to be way bigger in my opnion! It makes me think of Stranded Deep, Rust, Subnautica, all top notch games and this belongs along side them I'dd say!

Sunkenland is a fun game full of exploration, sunken cities and various islands, exciting gameplay, engaging building and base systems, combat, raiding, etc.

I would avoid the discord server though as it is yet another discord server with toxic mods that turn people away from their discord when you try to make the game safe for all but calling out nudity in-game via ingame neon art signs, and get told to drop it, or timed out by childish chat mods trying to delete that chat and sweep it under the rug and try to say I'm making claims about adding nudity or some garbage when I am only asking for it to be either removed or made appropriate for all ages. I had to quit the discord to escape the toxicity there from some hostile mods.

The game outside of the discord server is 5/5 stars and it gets new updates all the time. 
I am looking forward to what comes next.
Work is obviously ongoing, but it's very enjoyable.

Its a good start to a new game but lacks alot of content so fingers crossed for the future. This game has the potential to be a GOTY. im 80 percent through completing the map. Its good fun i dont know how it will play out as PVP im currently playing on solo.  The building could do with some tweaking. having an ability to build down as well as up would help. or the ability to set snaps when placing foundations.

I discovered this game via a YouTube (Kage848), and I gotta say... It is a very fun game so far, a little buggy, but, the bugs are being squashed at very good rate.

I highly recommend giving this game a try!
for an early stage game this is so sick! cant wait to watch the game grow into an even more sick cunt game!

Early process and has some insane potential. Movement is kind of clunky and overall the game is a bit laggy, but i love the humor and attention to detail in base cosmetics. I recommend this game based on the base building & looting aspect alone.
It's early access so it does have its quirks, hopefully ironed out over time.
My only issue is the combat. Although not tragic it alone is a bit under-done. The AI will shoot you through things/anything but you cannot do the same to them. Hit registration does not always proc. It's not a game breaking issue, more frustrating really.
That aside, I'd give the game 6 out of 10 at this stage. I am keen to see what they can implement in the future in regards to DLC, quests, building, exploration, etc.
The other gripe I have is that I have to physically remove my save files out of the game file to play co-op & vice versa to again play solo. The game doesn't support multi-saves or multiple game worlds. 
Anywho, give it a try. It is in fair shape for what it is. The underwater world is done really well.

A Promising Dive into Sunkenlands - Early Access Gem with Room for Growth

Rating: 3.5 Stars

Sunkenlands is a game that holds immense promise, offering an exciting concept that sets it apart in the gaming world. However, while it shines in certain aspects, it faces some challenges when it comes to scaling up for multiple players.

The game truly comes to life when played in a small group setting. During my initial 17 hours of gameplay with a single friend, I found Sunkenlands to be an absolute blast. The cooperative experience of exploring a submerged world, gathering resources, and overcoming challenges together was nothing short of exhilarating. This experience prompted me to invite two more friends to join in, as I envisioned creating a new world from scratch with a larger team.

However, my excitement was somewhat short-lived. Within a mere 5 hours of gameplay with the expanded group of four, we had completed all that the game's first world had to offer. This was a stark contrast to the initial 17 hours it had taken my friend and me to achieve the same milestones. It appears that the ease of progress may be attributed to the abundance of resources available to a larger group, although I am uncertain about what could be done to balance the game for larger parties. Despite this scaling issue, it's important to note that Sunkenlands still manages to deliver an enjoyable gaming experience.

One standout feature of Sunkenlands is its portrayal of territorial sharks, which adds a layer of realism and immersion that many other games in the genre lack. This attention to detail is commendable and enhances the overall gameplay.

As an early access title, Sunkenlands distinguishes itself from the myriad of underwhelming games in the same genre. For a modest investment of $20, I found myself engrossed in the game for 20-30 hours. The potential for continued content updates further sweetens the deal. It's entirely possible that Sunkenlands will evolve and grow over time, making it an enticing prospect to return to in a few months.

In conclusion, Sunkenlands is a game with a unique concept and solid foundations. It excels in small group play, providing hours of entertainment. However, it does face challenges in scaling up for larger parties, and this aspect could benefit from further attention from the developers. Nevertheless, as an early access title, it already offers good value for money and holds the promise of even greater things to come. Dive into Sunkenlands now and watch as it continues to develop into something truly remarkable.

Game is very fun so far, a bit of work needed with combat and after you kill attackers that have crossbow or other various weapons, when you go to loot them there is nothing to loot or very little and none of the weapons they are using against you. I have killed a lot and yet to have one crossbow drop of any kind, broken or good or bad condition. have gotten a knife and a few spiked clubs but no other weapon of any kind that has been used against me in raids against my base. That however is minor, the overall game play is very smooth and very fun, have not had so far any issues reported on other reviews. I really like how they have a lot of things in place, graphics are nice, base building is nice however i did run across a small glitch for base roof placement not snapping into place and giving me a red icon and not being able to place it although all requirements are met to place it in specific location such as pillar support, walls etc.  I would recommend this to anyone who likes survival games. I am sure there will be patches to fix any minor issues that arise, they already have been and the Devs seem very willing and active in making the game a success.

I have played many survival crafting open world games. Subsistence, infected, mist, night of the dead, 7dtd. This game has taken elements from all and has created an amazing world. I have just scratched the surface and cant get enough. Love the whole underwater concept, marauders and mutants. I sincerely hope the developers dont abandon this game, It can be incredible and extremely fun for hours and hours and hours. I look forward to many more hours immersed in this underwater world. Yes there are a few bugs mainly around the boats but the option to "push" the boat usually solves that.   I have so much to unlock and discover and I cant wait!! So after playing for about 30 hours give or take here is what I recommend.  Batteries lose charge way to fast especially in the flashlite oxygen tanks dont last long enough, More purchasing options at the trader. would like a better warning on the screen if I am bleeding, Need some kind of defense for when they attack from the water. Bandits dont seem to take any damage from the wall spikes. Instead of having to demolish a wall to change it to a reinforced...we should just be able to "upgrade" , I noticed that repairing structures after a fight dont cost any materials,,, they should. should have islands repopulate with their respective factions after a set time. Way to many clothes and neon signs and other "trophies" . Should have less food and drinkables to scavenge to focus more on fishing and farming. I dont believe there should be so many different weapons and types of transportation. Should be more sharks in the water. Still,,, I play it nonstop and have a blast..highly recommend this game.

This game has the foundations of something awesome. for me personally, I needed to keep up with the various challenges by keeping up with my resources. 
It is challenging but fun at the same time. It is early access but the positives outweigh the negatives.
When you're chillin in your base making stuff and messing around all of a sudden you get invaded by enemies which is fun for me. 
It would be nice if the devs made some kind of rebreather or scuba tank that lets you stay under water for longer instead of switching out tanks. Some parts you need to go pretty deep. But maybe they meant for that as a feature of urgency.  

I have played for around 12 hours and still have more to explore. The map size is big but not unnecessarily spread out to where its annoying and pointless. 

I've played on normal and the enemies are challenging when they have guns. Although there isn't much of a story yet i wont spoil what happens on the various islands. And they are abundant and hopefully they add more. 

All in all, I recommend this game. It is entertaining, and you need to prioritize in order to be successful.

Whilst I have only played 2.5hr I am v impressed with this game.  I v rarely feef the need to write reviews, but this game warrants it.  I bought it after enjoying Raft and Subnautica, as well as Stranded Deep.  This game is similar to all of them.  It is not as reallistic graphically as SD or SubN, but much better than Raft.  It is v relaxing to play and frankly easy (on default settings), but I  dont mine that.  The learning curve is not punishing and if you have played these sorts of survival games before you will not struggle.  It does not take long at all to build a home with a bed, some storage and a grill and purifier so you can shut the door at night and cook!  Obviously the big selling point is the uinderwater exploration, whihc looks and works pretty darn well so far.  I have literally only just finished scavenging the reef walls of my starter island (2hrs) and can see the map is HUGE.  Definite thumbs up from me so far.

This game is in development so I understand a lot will be polished and made better.  I've enjoyed this game so far.  That being said, the raids on your base get frustrating as you are learning the game as there is no tutorial presently.  I turned off raids and that has made my game much more enjoyable.  I think some suggestions I'd offer as a solution would be to scale the enemy weapons in the game to your own technological advances (I think this could be a setting you can toggle on and off as needed).  Recently, I spent a chunk of time fending off a raid (I was low on ammunition as I had just unlocked the ability to build that) and then died several times running to one lone gunman with a shotgun who would pick me off as I got close.  This was after he (the npc) blew apart my base with his shotgun from the other end of the island.  Griping aside, I keep coming back to this game as I enjoy the exploration and building (I likely will eventually turn raids back on once I'm more acquainted with the game)

They fixed the save file issue that might still be reported all over the review section and as such this early acess has been quite fun to play with a friend and even got plenty hours out of it. The biggest issue however, something I spotted within the first 2 hours of play: You are playing a game about exploration, gathering and base defense where the world is given finite resources. This is bad. Doubly so when you spend some resources inefficiently or decide to rebuild your base elsewhere or a second base or anything like it. You will now be consistently facing enemy raids on your home spawning over time whilst eventually all the resources for building and crafting will be used up. Food and drink has a multitude of ways to acess infinite replenishes, but building parts for bases, vehicles and equipment you only got what the world will drop ONCE. 

Not only that but it also means due to previous finite amount of places to visit and loot the "exploration and gathering" will dry up. No idea how some people get more than 30 hours out of the current game as by then you should have looted everything and all that is left is afking in your base or collecting Ore (one of the only respawing resouces). This needs to be fixed in one way or another.

My initial review is this game is a beautiful game,  scenery,  water, and starting constructions.    I love the concept of this game,  reminds me of rust/stranded deep/7d2d with a little subsistence thrown in.    I don't think island and underwater areas is enough to be a multiplayer game as of right now,   not enough area to explore or loot for up to 15 players.   For multiplayer you'd honestly need an entire world or a map 5 times the size.  This is a great size for a single player or maybe dual player game as it sits.  Vector3 studios has done a wonderful job building this world and adding things that people like.  I think everyone should play this game or at least buy it and come along for the ride.  I hope to see many many new maps pop up and maybe the ability to make our own islands and our own maps in creative to share in a workshop for us to use for a play through in the future.   Single player the ability to pause the game instead of saving and logging out.   I do like that it was a fully functioning game to start and the Devs have plans to make this game much much more than it is.   Lots of help on their discord as well.   2 thumbs up so far.

So far the game has pulled me in and the environments I've explored are engaging. The progression is well paced and underwater diving isn't at all slow. In fact, diving exploration is what you'll engage most in early game. Many islands are dangerous and filled with factions to face. The guns are pack a punch and feel good to use, gun play is smooth so far though I didn't opt into black powder guns so I can't speak on those. The red dot sight doesn't make the normal reticle go away and makes aiming with some weapons difficult. The devs seem involved and have dropped a road map, hopefully they add public timelines to that to hold themselves accountable. 

I bought the game on sale and felt it was worth the sale price. If this game continues to update it'll be worth the 20 dollar asking price. Also time for some cons. Some textures such as the washing machine are just awful, other textures are amazing. Weird divide. The enemy AI isn't very reactive. Enemies won't rush you with melee weapons instead opting to stand still waiting to be shot most times. They also won't react to when their buddy right next to them is head shot, in fact they don't really react to missed shots either. The trader is lacking as well. I hope to see either more traders with different inventories or the trader cycling their inventory instead of it always being the same. Sharks are also static and weak. I feel they should spawn randomly near the player while diving and have higher health pools. Sharks can also swim through walls to bite you and most times will miss their attacks on you. Several times now I've become stuck underwater and had to wait to just die. Smelting ores also takes years upon years and should not feel like a chore. The woodworking bench sound when turned on makes me want to turn the audio off and is painful to listen to.

It's a challenging survival game that is under water. The game is in early access, but is good so far.

I've been playing this game off and on for around 2 weeks. I tried this game even when it had mixed and strong bad reviews (because it was on sale lol). From everything I have personally experienced, I am more and more in love with it. It's very similar to Raft/Small Land building concepts. The biggest challenge (for me) is scavenging items underwater and not drowning, but that's a user error. Played this co-op without the issues I've read about. I truly love the view, both above and especially under water. I'm excited to see the improvements coming forward as I've already seen them in the past few weeks of dabbling in the game. I love the packaging implementation so I can move my stuff around the base and not just destroy it, losing materials in the process. To be honest, a lot of the negative reviews I've read are of people that don't know what they are doing. This is a new game, a lot to learn (which I love!), and they are constantly updating and listening to their player base. Bottom line, I am in love and look forward to what else they implement in this game. Give it a try - even if it isn't on sale!

Fun game, pretty water, shoot all the bad guys. Build good traps and fortifications,  turn raids and difficulty to highest and enjoy the free loot deliveries! 

Tips: Leave an item in loot objects to rejuvenate them upon reloading.

Carry canned food and energy drinks or other good survival foods and healing.
Guns guns guns guns guns.
fun looting and discovering stuff, cant wait for the full game :)
Would recommend this to everyone that likes survival games it is one of the best. I love it. Try it out.
Totally engaging  game.  Crafting is the most important  component of the game Plenty to keep the single player or the group busy .

Definitely Early Access release, but team clearly engaged and working.

Best combination of Raft/Stranded Deep taking place in Water World.

A good level of complexity and tiered crafting/skills.
I like the multiple enemy factions, and progress complete markers for each island.
(Enemy AI is simplistic, but it's early, and if you aren't paying attention or armored up they can be punishing).

The diving to loot & swim speed vs oxygen needs/burn rate is pretty good for tiered craft/leveling.
Flippers for speed
meds/herbs for oxygen time
multiple tiered foods with different buffs (for oxygen and swim speed)
Craftable air tanks with a craftable hand crank air pump.

Food/Water aren't onerous (well no more than on Raft/Stranded... once you have the systems setup it's manageable.  With advanced systems they require much less maintenance)

Building/Structures still need some polish, but are quite functional enough to base and defense build.

Decorations are plentiful, would love an easier pickup method, but there is a packing box to pickup placed things, and a grinder/recycler for some items.

Not much island wildlife yet, but I suspect more will come with time.  (the last patch has most creatures swimming upside down, lol.)

haven't used all the ships, but they are quite useful.
Would love to see more customization in the future and/or more storage.

All in all enjoying it in its early stages, and look forward to much entertainment in a group/co-op setting.

Also hoping for map randomization and a few other things, but I'm good waiting for good features.


If you're a "serious" or "realism" survival game player, skip for now.  If you enjoyed raft or stranded deep (or even Subnautica)  you might give this a swing.

P.S. I still haven't seen the Submariner or the King of the 'Smokers' yet.  ;)
Pretty awesome so far. Feels like subnautica meets raft meets stranded deep. Or more accurately Waterworld as a game :D

Fantastic game.
For an Early Access, this one has an AMAZING level of content. Exploration is very fun, and base defence is just the right amount of thrill. The progression is as fast or slow as you want it, and looks like way more fun with 2 players. It could use a bit more scattering of ore on starting islands, and smelters need to hold more than a single ore, but otherwise no complaints. 10/10 great game.

overall after putting almost 50 hours into this game and almost 1000 into Valhiem i would say this game has a lot of potential 
Pros 
The adventure with the different factions adds another style of game play i really have never seen before and depending on the faction They don't really act like NPC.(alot of random movements)
Also unlike alot of games when they apply water and food into the game play this actually feel balanced with how much it replenishes and diminishes also with how it can be found but not to much where it feels pointless. 
The travelling unlike in most games feels really nice and speedy without feeling to crazy. 
Easily laid out so no matter what new things you don't need 3rd party information
Quick at fixing bugs and updating. 

Cons 
When raids happen it just becomes a shoot off because the raiders wont try to get close.
The world generation is repetitive and does not have a new generation when you create a new world.
Once you make everything it doesn't feel like there are to many fun side projects
Repetitive trader that does not feel like it has much use.

But overall I found this game very enjoyable and has a lot of potential and i highly recommend for a nice game to play on a Friday night.

I've played for only 10 hours but have grinded out the tier list for research items to see what all is available. Here's a list of ideas/fixes that I would like to see as a survivor game enjoyer.

1. Larger storage containers/Higher tier storage
 -The backpacks are great but the storage space could at least match the backpack storage size. Maybe a higher tier option 
 in the future.

2. Ability to move placed items/decorations.
  -It's frustrating to expand the base and the only option is to scrap, rebuild, and waste more materials to re-locate a 
 workbench or any other item.

3. All keybind change options. 
 -Cannot change the "Scavenge" ( F key).

4/ Scroll wheel option for tool belt items
 -Personal preference, but would be a nice feature to have.

5. Ability to upgrade existing structures with the building hammer
 -Same comment as #2

6. Trader restock times

7. Larger item stacks

8. Compass indicator for direction

9. Health bar for enemies 

Overall, I really enjoy the game and think it's fairly decent for an early access game. Looking forward to future updates!

As an early access game Sunkenlands has me hooked, what a pleasant surprise, that being said few of the mechanics will need more work:
Combat:
feels a bit janky, NPC's font seem to react much to you sniping them from distance, also raids should be more predictable to allow you to venture and explore the world more early on in the game. 
Wood & Coal:   
also the inability to use coal for fueling to me seems a bit weird as everything requires wood to produce power and you are left with a staggering amount of coal, perhaps have coal become a fuel source for the later tech items as once you get past the basic guns coal is pretty much just a trading commodity with the shop keeper. 

All in all still think that the 30+ hours i have spent on this game was well worth it. cant wait to see how this develops in the future.  keep up the good work!

First off this game, as of 9/5/23 its pretty good for you and a couple friends to hop on and grind.
If you got $15 or whatever it is right now, it is worth it.

However, the motion blur you have feels like I just got out of a car after driving for 12 hours straight and the world is still moving around you.
You cannot turn this off. 
There is some other bugs throughout the game, including fish flying through under water objects, inventory bugs with chests, "Chest is occupied" but the only person near is you, choppy frame rate as passenger on the boat, AI just isn't "smart enough" aka feels like sloppy AI mechanics, needs a frame rate lock for main screen, etc.
I'm sure i'm missing a few major bugs, but tbh its been alright. Being someone who bought 2042 on launch, I will say this aint anywhere near that.

Some suggestions:
Get rid of motion blur completely.
Fix frame rate/maybe some memory leaks?
Add smarter AI mechanics. Add more AI models. Add AI bosses/human or not.
Add weather mechanics like rain, heavy weather the damages the bases, lighting etc
Add more music throughout the day/night cycle.
Add AI that raid bases on boats.
Add darker night cycles/change the moon phase.
-----
Add more crafting items. It's pretty basic. but there is alot to digest at first. Maybe stuff thats interactive more with the player. Radios that call other AI ships, civilians?  
Add more quests. Needs to be an objective thats more clear. If there is one, it wasn't apparent to anyone
Need objectives to do or it will just get repetitive 
Air drops? Random emergency flare that you can find/buy (expensive) and calls airdrops??
Armour doesn't make sense. Make it break, or show values as hud or something.
Needs a better healing system thats more in depth, sickness maybe? Swimming underwater and coming up too quick???
Would like to see this world we get randomly generated, instead of copy paste. Maybe multiple versions of the same map so you never know?
Add iron more under water in the deeper parts.
Add more underwater objects and things to explore 
Increase the air tank time
--------------

Sum it up, buy this game, play it in 6 months.
But if you're bored, with a bunch of friends, it is a blast, until it bugs out or someone gets sick IRL. 
7/10 (9/6/23)
Would buy.

About 8 hours in, it's a fun little adventure game. I play solo, so its kind of more just chill and explore after work for me. This game will probably excel as a co-op game. It's in a decent stage, given its in alpha, definitely playable co-op. I'm interested to see where the developers go with it. It's good enough that I bought it as a gift for someone else.

FYI, 
Character json file: %AppData%\LocalLow\Vector3 Studio\Sunkenland\Characters\
- The character json file is your character. You can tweak it there
- The file with the uuid (the filename with a bunch of crazy numbers and letters), save and look at date modified that will tell you the correct one. I think there is one for each world you've played on. If you copy that text into the file that appears when you change worlds you can bring over your characters loadout, inventory, quick bar, and gear items. Also, it will bring what you've explored and what you have researched.

World json file: %AppData%\LocalLow\Vector3 Studio\Sunkenland\Worlds\
- Haven't played with this much.


If something happens json is easily editable, at least in single player mode. I haven't tested it in multiplayer, I assume it will work just fine given the way the worlds seem to work. Just save and quit, Then from the menu screen you can make your changes, remember to save the file. I've started tracking items ids however my list is short. If it gets more conclusive maybe I'll add it to the wiki. I personally like viewing json in Visual Studio Code, it's free, just give it a google. Also, you're not the best with computers you may be more comfortable simply pressig alt + f4 immediately if something terrible happens.

Feedback: I hope that in the future they increase the time when you hook a fish, you have to react almost instatly as far as I can tell. I haven't caught one yet.

I hope this helps, have fun.

I've journeyed through countless virtual worlds, survived apocalyptic scenarios, and braved the harshest of terrains, but nothing quite prepared me for the unparalleled experience that Sunkenland offers. This game stands as a testament to the ingenuity of the survival genre and has rapidly become one of the best survival games I've had the pleasure of playing. Having tested my mettle in numerous survival titles, Sunkenland's unique blend of immersive gameplay and its relentless pursuit of realism make it a true standout.

From the moment I stepped foot in this sunken world, I was immediately drawn into its breathtaking landscapes and atmospheric soundscape. The visual design is nothing short of stunning, with vibrant flora and fauna, intricate underwater caverns, and an ever-present sense of desolation that keeps you on edge. It's as if the game world is a character in itself, constantly evolving and adapting to challenge and captivate players.

But it's not just the aesthetics that make Sunkenland exceptional. The gameplay mechanics are masterfully crafted, offering a level of depth that keeps you engaged for hours on end. Survival in this sunken realm is no easy feat; you must master underwater exploration, resource gathering, crafting, and combat, all while contending with the unpredictable elements of the ocean. The progression system is equally well-designed, rewarding players for their ingenuity and perseverance.

However, like all great games, there's always room for improvement, and Sunkenland is no exception. While it already offers an incredible experience, I can't help but imagine the potential for even greater depths of immersion. Here are a few ideas for future updates that could elevate Sunkenland to even greater heights:

Expanded Lore and Storyline: Develop a rich narrative that unveils the mysteries of the sunken world, giving players a more profound connection to their surroundings and objectives.

Underwater Ecosystem: Introduce a dynamic ecosystem where players can witness the interactions between marine life, making the ocean feel more alive.

Random Events: Add random events, such as underwater storms or rare aquatic creatures, to keep players on their toes and create even more immersive experiences.

In conclusion, Sunkenland is a true gem in the world of survival gaming, offering an unmatched level of immersion and challenge. Its breathtaking visuals, engaging gameplay, and attention to detail set it apart from the competition. While already a fantastic game, the potential for future expansions and improvements is immense, promising even greater adventures in the sunken world. Dive in and experience the depths of Sunkenland for yourself; you won't be disappointed.
Having way too much fun in this game...get it!

Well, the game is ok ish. The main issue is that it lacks a lot of content. In about 15 hours, the game was basically finished.

Content issue:
The merchant doesnt provide anything substantial, no unique weapon, skin to firearm, idk man anything cool, stuff to make the diving experiance much easier, end game stuff.
The enemies on pretty much all the islands are pretty much always the same end game. There is no bosses, no cool underwater research facility to explore, 
I dont think you can build underwater base.
Some ressources seems to be finite as they come mainly from chest and lootable(that doesnt seem to respawn...unsure...) making it an issue if you would want to play long term, even if there is no long term goal.
The fighting strategy is pretty much always the same, you hear the music change, look around...find enemy, shoot once in the head the homanoid enemy, he dies and his loot provides ammo for the next enemy...its pretty meh...


Trolls in PVE:
Some trolls moved into our server and basically destroyed all our walls, our crafting gear, etc. There is no way to basically protect yourself vs this. no differents tribes in pve, every1 can move into your server, build a repair hammer and begin destroying the stuff you spent a few days to make. It makes effectivelly building on a sand castle. You can't create a substantial base and it makes playing with unknown players a problem.

Issue with the game:
The humanoid enemies do not shoot where their gun are pointed at. (visually, they can point their gun 90 degree away from ya, and still shoot straight in your face, this makes sneaking on enemies virtually impossible with melee weapon or w/e.)
When you die, the "close" respawn is sometimes closer to another island rather than the island you are at.
Sometimes, enemies are protected by invisible walls...especially true for handrail and see through fences.
Grenades and such will not damage yourself if the "friendly fire is off"
You can swim faster than some boats, making some boats feels rather irrelevant.

No real PVP content:
There is basically no end game content in sunkenland.


In short: 
The lack of end game content/ goals and repeatability of mobs from island to island makes the game a very short term game. 
The social aspect of the game is pretty much killed by trolls that threaten to destroy all your stuff.
The building of a base is pointless as enemy waves are easilly dispatched and no pvp is optimize base building. Lack of useful defensible construction stuff.
The underwater exploration is pretty moot, as you farm once or twice then need to go back up to the surface for air. 
The little content there is fine, but it lacks a lot of it in order to have a long term goals/gaming experience with the game.

**Playing in Early Access**
This game is very well done considering the number of people working on it and how long they've been developing it (7 people for less that one year). It's like Rust™  meets 'Waterworld'. 
You're dropped in near a deserted island and have to survive. Mats and items can be found on the various islands, floating structures, and underwater areas. Much of the equipment/weapons/armor that you'll need can be found, but a lot can be crafted as well (either by raw materials or by finding broken items and repairing/upgrading them). There are elemental, natural, and humanistic aspects to overcome.
The progression of the game hits the sweet spot; you don't start as a fully helpless babe in the woods, but you also have to work for the good stuff. 
Overall, a fun game to play, well developed for an Early Access, and with so much more to come (per their discord).
